review_content: Burk från SB. Brunsvart med ljusbeige krona. Rostade toner, kola, torr, törstsläckande.

0,33l bottle from Carrefour store drinking on 6/09/2021 BB 07.01.2022 Pours a nice clear dark chestnut brown with good creamy beige foam on top and moderate lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, barley, grains, chocolate, cocoa, nutty. Taste again shows notes of roasted malt, grains, chocolate and a touch of caramel, some earthy hops, sweet but not overly so, not really bitter. It's light and drinkable with 4.7% abv and good tasting, easy and without many flaws. A bit dry and light bitter finish. Light body, slightly oily texture and smooth palate with moderate carbonation. Not incredible but still pretty good to me, very easy drinking and would definitely recommend.

33cl Bottle @ Erasmus Bruin Cafe, Salamanca, Spain.
Dark brown colour with a thin tan head.
Aroma is toasted malt, sweet, straw.
Taste is toasted malt, sweet, bread, hints of chocolate.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Zakupione w Lidlu w markecie, pierwszy raz piłem ciemnego lagera gdzie spodziewałem się połączenia stouta z lagerem, jest smaczny.
Тъмна чешка бира с наситен (малко "тежък") горчив вкус и отговарящо алкохолно съдържание (4,7%).

0.5 can from Aroma, branded as "Budvar Tmavy ležák"

Pours dark black cola color with thin white caramel color head. Toffee aroma. Roasted coffee, heavy grain, intensive taste. Mild carbonation, not very enjoyable.

Can from the LCBO. 
Dark brown pour, with a medium light brown head. Aroma is sweet dark malts, light fruitness, and some roasty cereals, and soft coffee. There is a soft schwarzbier flavour in there too. A touch of smoke, nice mouth feel, soft carb. Low bitterenss, light smoky finish, with a soft fruity maltiness.

Bottle. Dark brown, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light bread and faint roasted malt, faint hoppyness. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint caramel/faint bread, with faint roasted malt, faint hoppyness. Finish is short to average, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish, faint caramel, with faint roasted malt, faint hoppyness and light metal. Your typical dark lager - not overly too sweet though. Finish has more sharp metal than bitterness.
Pours clear light black with sizable stable tan head malty slightly sour aroma, crisp and clean with a hint of sweetness and roset in the neck
Rating catch up. Shared 24/4/2021 with Dan and Grumbo. No full review but rating breakdown taken and discussed at the time.
De color negro, con un pequeño cordón de espuma de retención media. De cuerpo y carbonatación media. Aroma a malta tostada y chocolate. Sabor dulce y con la aparición leve de caramelo.
Found out of bottle from Auchan in Rybnik, Poland. Pours an appealing black with airy white foam. Standard  aroma. Heavy but above average flavor for the style. More of a fall option than anything.

24/4/2021. Bottle shared with D&J at the welcome to Eva beer share. From Beers Of Europe. Pours clear very dark reddish brown with a frothy off-white head. Good looking pour. Aroma of roasted malt, nut, caramel, burnt chocolate, touch of ash and veggie notes. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Not a style I particularly enjoy but this was okay.

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień w celu uzupełnienia profilu na RateBeer.
Instagram/czgr_

50 cl bottle (BBD 2021-05-13), bought from Oli Food Centre (SE17 2NA), drunk at home 2021-03-03.

Appearance is a clear ruby/deep brown with a thick, dense coffee crema coloured head that dissipates at a moderate rate. Reasonable amount of visible carbonation. Pretty nice - I'd like the head to be a little more persistent I think but not a major complaint.

Aroma isn't bad - reminiscent of an ESB or similar to me. Some caramel, some brown bread malt, something slightly sweeter - liquorice? Vanilla? Maybe a hint of spice? I like it - perhaps a touch subtle, but a nice array of notes from the malts.

Taste is good. Again, there's some almost vanilla like sweetness, but there's definitely also a dried fruit note, a touch of caramel, a hint of bready malt and a gentle earthy bitterness to finish. Well-balanced throughout. Again, maybe a touch subtle, but it's very pleasant - reminiscent of a porter.

Palate is okay. Medium-light body, a moderate amount of in-mouth carbonation, smooth throughout. A touch thin at the front, but becomes slightly drier during the moderate length finish. I want a little more body.

Overall, I quite like this. It's generally subtle, but well-balanced with a nice mix of sweeter and maltier notes. Not much from the hops, but that's not a problem for a dark lager for me. I think my one big thing on the wish list would be a more robust body.

50 cl bottle (BBD 2021-05-13), bought from Oli Food Centre (SE17 2NA), drunk at home 2021-03-03.…

From green bottle in Leipzig, Germany. Pours black with a three-finger dense tan head. Aroma and taste is chocolate, caramel, roasted malts. Mild sweetness. Hint of bitterness. Very easy to drink and nice. Creamy mouthfeel.
I've been drinking this beer for a long time, so I'm just taking this here to keep it written
Mørk brun med beige skum. Aroma malt karamell sjokolade. Smak røster malt sjokolade karamell noe kaffe. Middels fylde, søtlig i ettersmaken. Flaske smakt April -13
Black color with tanned head. Aroma has caramel, dark malt, chocolate and licorice. Taste is malty sweet with long sweet aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, dark malt, chocolate and licorice.

Keg half at Pembury Tavern, Hackney April 2019. Pours clear ruby dark brown with a beige cap. Aroma: caramel, burnt, light chocolate, coffee hints. Taste: moderate sweet & light bitter, sweet malts, caramel, fruity, chocolate. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation

Аромат весьма сильно жженый, немного жареный солод, прямо нотки от зерен шоколада, весьма сухой, намеки на шоколад и бобы. Цвет полу темный, пенка средняя. Вкус питкий, но при этом сбалансированный и явный. Снова много солода, жженый солод с нотами темного шоколада и кофе, карамель на оттенке. В послевкусие сухость, уже больше кофе, может кислинка легкая. В общем норм темный лагер.

Svartbrun vätska med lät gräddigt och ljust kaffefärgat skum. Lätt sädig, brödig doft med en liten ton av rostat kaffe. Rostad maltkropp med en aningen för mycket våt/rå säd i smaken. Beskan är stram och neutral.

Klare dunkelbraune Farbe mit weißer Schaumkrone. Malziger, leicht röstmalziger Geruch. Geschmacklich malzig, leicht röstmalzig, leicht cremig rauchig. Mittlere Süße mit leichter Bitterkeit, mittlerer Körper mit sanfter Kohlensäure.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Opalizujący  rubin. Piana spora. Z drobnych bąbelków. Beżowa. Ogólnie wygląd zbliżony do porteru. 
Aromat mało intensywny. Lekko kawowy z nutą chmielu. 
Akuratnie wysycone. Trochę wodniste. Elementy kawowe. Delikatna paloność i słodycz. 
Stonowane – nie przegięte w żadną stronę. W smaku da się wyczuć że się pije ciemne. 
Trochę za grzeczne, bez pazurka i ciała. Ale solidne – warto raz kiedyś spróbować.
Creamy on the palate. Dark, refreshing and very light. With roast in taste, just a little. Very weak aroma of roast of some kind. Thin body. Almost no bitterness.

Ciemne, klarowne, piana obfita po nalaniu.
W aromacie trochę nut chlebowych.
W smaku delikatny karmel, goryczka niska.
Malty caramel aroma. Dark brown color with medium head. Little bitterness. Light body.

0.5 l bottle. Dark brown color beer with medium head. Aroma of malt, 
roasted bread. Tasre is sweet,  bread, malt.

Sept 2020 500ml tall green bottle, filtered, from Beers of Europe. I'm OK with dark lagers these days. I like the flavour. But, yeah, the mouthfeel is a bit wet and vanishing, so they're not at the top of my list. This is nicely flavoured. Works for me. [2.7] 

Feb 2008. Tap at Ship Centurion, Whitstable. Named Dark Lager. Light mouthfeel. Coffee grounds flavoured frisky carbonated lager. Blur of caramel in the finish. I’ve never quite got dark lagers. The light, clean body of a lager is fine for delivering a crisp, refreshing, thirst quenching drink that also cleans the palates - but when you combine it with dark, considered flavours there is an uncomfortable and unsettling clash. This was new to the Ship and the regulars were keen to try it - but it wasn’t proving popular with either the lager drinkers (nah, give us the Bitbuger) nor the ale  drinkers (I prefer the Elgood’s Black Dog). I suspect the novelty of a black lager will soon wear thin, and the Budvar will be going home. [2.2]
Aromă de malţ prăjit , caramelă. Gust de pîine brună, malţ prăjit, puţin amărui cu un post gust uşor dulce
Bottle from Kaufland Domazlice - dark brown color, beige head. dark malts, coffee, roasted malts. medium to high sweetness. medium dry finish. nice.

Dark brown color, medium stable beige head. 
Roasted malts and nuts, brown bread and caramel in the nose. 
Taste is a bit sweet, roasted malts dominate, traces of coffee and dark chocolate are also present. Medium bitter, medium carbonation, medium body. 
Not bad.
Aroma is malts/slightly burnt and toffee/caramel.  The flavor is fruit, malts/slightly burnt and a smooth/mildly sweet toffee finish.

0,5 l
Jako pitki, solidan tamni lager.. aroma čokolade, boja crna s rubinskim odsjajem, pjena postojana..okus kave i čokolade, super je, vrlo pitak..

Enjoyed: Poured from bottle into mug. 
Appearance: Black/brownish colour , rich head which soon fades to smaller with nice lacing.
Aroma: Roasted malt, caramel, chocolate.
Palate: Light body, gentle carbonation.
Taste: Roasted malt, milk chocolate, caramel, gently bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Very easy and drinkable, tasty, refreshing; for every occasion.

Ciemnobrunatne, rubinowe, klarowne piwo z obfitą pianą która opadając lekko zdobi szkło. Aromat karmelu, prażonych orzechów, pieczonego chleba, sugeruje piwo o słodszym smaku. Smak jest zaś wytrawny, czuć  palone słody, czekoladę i kawę. Zdecydowanie na plus

Das Bier hieß früher nur "Budweiser Budvar Tmavý Ležák" und wurde dann wie alle anderen großen Biere der Brauerei umbenannt, und dem großen internationalen Publikum die tschechischen Hačeks (umgedrehte Dacherl über Buchstaben) zu ersparen. Jetzt heißt es halt Budweiser Budvar B:Dark, drinnen ist natürlich das selbe.
Ich habe es schon ein paar mal, sogar vor Ort, getrunken (und mit Prozent bewertet). Da die Grenze nach Tschechien noch immer zu ist, griff ich im heimischen Supermarkt in Melk an der Donau zu.
Es ist natürlich ein Industriebier und man bekommt nicht die große Kreativität geliefert, aber rein geschmacklich finde ich es wirklich gut. Es ist nicht süß, sondern ist wie ein klassisches tschechisches Dunkles, das eher mit dem deutschen Schwarzbier zu vergleichen ist.
Sicher kein Ersatz für hochqualitative Craftbiere, aber ein solides Dunkles, das mir wirklich geschmeckt hat.

"Budweiser B:Dark", Flasche von Edeka. - Tiefdunkles Rotbraun, üppiger Schaum. – In der Nase mildes Röstmalz, feine Karamelsüße, dezente Frucht und sparsame Hintergrundhopfung. - Antrunk schlank dunkelmalzig mit runden Röstaromen (Kakao). Feine karamellige Süße, ein Hauch von Weinbrandkirsche. Milde aber ausreichende herbale Hopfung. Etwas milder rezent, weich im Mund, trocken. Rund malzbitterer, fein herber Abgang. - Süffiges, fein komponiertes Schwarzbier, weich aber mit Tiefgang. (25.4.2020.)

How: bottle, fridge cold. BB: 29.11.2020
Head: off white, two fingers.
Colour: deep dark brown.
Aroma: coffee, campfire, light herbal hops, light banana.
Taste: thin body, above average carbonation, coffee and campfire.
Medium long aftertaste follows aroma and taste.
Quite simple& straight forward.

Piwo barwy ciemno brązowej, prawie całkowicie klarowne. Piana jasno beżowa, gęsta, zbudowana głównie z drobnych oczek, znikając nieznacznie zdobi szkło. 
Aromat to karmel, kawa, prażony słód, przypalony spód od ciasta, chleb razowy. W tle pałęta się nawet likierowo-czekoladowa nuta. 
Smak wytrawny, dominują paloność, przypieczony spód chleba, kawa na finiszu delikatna karmelowo-czekoladowa nutka. 
Goryczka popiołowa wyraźna choć krótka, wysycenie wysokie. 
Dobre ! Nawet bardziej podchodzi pod Schwartzbier niz pod tmave

Great czech dark lager. Appearance is beautiful, two finger head with good lacing on glass, aroma of caramel, chocolate and coffe. Medium body, taste of dark caramel and chocolate. I like it very much

Aroma : Deeply roasted almost burnt chocolate and caramel malts, touch of coffee and a light earthy hop note.  Taste : As aroma. Medium roasted bitterness all the way through. One of the best examples of the style I've had!

(500ml bottle, 4.7% ABV, Berlin. Feb 8, 2020)
AROMA: light mocha/toffee, malty, sweetness, grain/oats, 
APPEARANCE: dark mahogany brown, nice thick milk coffee colored foam. looks good. head does fade a bit quick
TASTE: taste follows the aroma, light coffee, milk chocolate, underlying backbone of roasted grain, dark bread, decent but not overly complex or rich (after it sat and warmed up a bit, the flavors were more pronounced, so I upped the taste score by one point)
PALATE: a bit light given the color, good fizz and freshness upfront, a bit weak/watery in the middle, dry charred wood on the finish but also quite muted

OVERALL:  a really good looking beer with a decent nose, the flavor and mouth feel are a bit understated. a pretty good beer, enjoyable, but missing a few things that could have made this a very good beer (instead of a good beer).
Dark brown, clear pour. Malty, very malty. Hint of coffee. Crisp and light, nice lager

Keg at Rutland and Derby Arms, Leicester. Dark brown, opaque with an uneven beige head and a lot of lacing. The aroma suggests that it may not be in optimum condition: among the dark malts typical of the style there's a metallic and vegetal, almost cressy note. Tastes ok though: sweet and malty with notes of Ovaltine and milk chocolate. Heavily carbonated. A good beer even if tbis particular specimen may be getting on a bit.
Dark brown color, large beige head. Aromas of malt, caramel, roasted hints and brown sugar. Taste of bread, roasted malt and earth.

0.5l can from a supermarket. Dark brown body, yellow-beige head. roasted, sour aroma, quite nice. Taste is chocolate, bit of caramel, bit of roasted malt. Hint of sourness.  Mild but persistent roasted bitter aftertaste.Moderate carbonation, mild silky palate. Simple, light, but well balanced and harmonic. One of the best examples of the genre.
dark brown body. licorice, near tartness, black malt. balanced taste. somewhat thin body but not unexpected for ABV/style. good and interesting.

Creamy tan head on a black still body.
Malt aroma.
Medium bodied, sharp on the palate with a clean back.
Bitter tangy tastes of berry, malt & spice

Похвалить Budweiser не чем. Довольно заурядное пиво, слабый хмелевый запах, чуть отдаёт жжёным солодом, вкус слабый и грубоватый. Чуть горький, чуть хмелевый, нет мягкости, больше воды во вкусе. Пена средняя, чуть коричневатая. Допивать бутылку 0,5 л. не хотелось. Цена у нас за него слишком высокая.

Riecht süßlich röstmalzig. Dunkelrotes Bier mit einer feinen Schaumkrone. Der Antrunk ist röstig herb. Aromen dunkler Schokolade und Kaffee, etwas Karamell und dunkle Trockenfrucht. Angenehm runder Geschmack, nicht zu stark carbonisiert. Besser als erwartet

Pours a mahogany colour with a persistent tan head. The aroma brings an interesting balance between the base malt character and the roasted perception. It's malty rich, with qualities such bread crust, sweetened coffee and cola. The flavour gives some hints of Munich malt presence to help to enrich the base malt character. No dark malt harshness at all. In the mouth, it has a medium body, somehow smooth and medium carbonation. Hops just to bring balance and freshness to the beer, but not to add too much bitterness. It has that Lager light and clean overall profile. It's a benchmark for the style, no doubt.
500ml bottle in 2013. Dark brown with a thick beige head. Aroma of dark malt, cola, coffee and cocoa. More crisp with dried fruit flavours and more lager malt.

Bottle at Bill's Woking. Burnt caramel aroma with some boiled veg. Dark - cola-esque. Thin creamy off-white head. Medium bitter with a tang. Malty. Coffee. Light-medium bodied. Slick. Low key fizzy carbonation. Dry finish. Tasty enough. Enjoyable.
Kremowa piana, głęboko rubinowa barwa. W aromacie nuty jakby Coca-Coli, trochę palonych słodów, kawy. Goryczka niska, dość słodkie, nieco kwaskowate, wodniste. Ujdzie.
W aromacie kawa i palone slody moze troche skorki od chleba. W smaku kawa zbozowa, delikatnie slodkawe z bardzo niska goryczka. Wysycenie srednio wysokie. Koncernowe a niezle :)
Definitely better than it's brother ''lager''. Would expect more ABV. Still little bit watery but ok beer.

A basic but good one. Dark brown color, nice foam, well-carbonated. Mild coffee, chocolate aroma thanks to roasted malt. Malty taste, with a mild bitter and sweet aftertaste. It's not watery and not insignificantly mild. It's pleasantly mild. Perfection.

Bevuta alla spina a Praga.
Aroma tostato. Aspetto scuro con schiuma alla Ceca.
Fr
# 64 et #1202, 7/2015 et 10/2018. Poměrně slušný tmavý ležák; přiměřeně sladký, karamelový, pražený, lehce ovocný a oříškový.
Op vakantie in Kroatië een zwart kleurig lichaam met een bruinige witte kop en met een mout caramel aroma een mout caramel beetje  chocolate zoet bitter smaak met een lichte bitter einde
Aromat słód, chleb, karmel. Barwa czarna, piana średnia. W smaku ciemny chleb, słód, karmel, kawa, biszkopty, lekka wodnistość. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie. Dobre.
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.

Bottle at Bill’s, a local branch of the restaurant chain. Served rather too cold. Pours a dark brown. Aroma of toast and a taste of roasted malts, brown bread and burnt toast. Good bitterness, but not too dry. Very drinkable.
Buena cerveza de estilo lager pilsner negra, de cuerpo ligero y sabor torrefacto

330ml bottle from Mega Image (I think) drunk overlooking the Sea Garden, Burgas during a summer storm. Pours clear cola-coloured with a minimal beige head, some lacing but no visible rising carbonation. Roast and toast with caramel but not even a suggestion of hops. In the mouth, not a lot of carbonation, mild bitterness but rising, dry texture, flavours similar to the aromas with a clean, crisp finish. No real yeastiness, but richly flavoured and refreshing, a pretty good Tmavy for year-round drinking.
Braunes Bier der schaum ist schön, im Geruch unangenehm malzig, im Geschmack wässrig malzig mit fehlton, nicht mein Ding

On the tap is better than in a bottle!
The aroma of roasted malt and a little caramel.
sourish taste with bitterness of roasted malt.

Bottle from Kaufland 2019-06-13 Markerska
AR: red peppery, wee chocolate and coffey
AP: dark brown, wee beige head
F: very dry, sota, bakers chocolate and wee coffey, grainy mouthfeeling, tar,

Budweiser ciemny czyli raczej rzadko spotykany w Polsce rodzaj. Niezbyt intensywny co jest plusem poniewaź nie gustuję w tym gatunku chociaż bardziej minusem ponieważ spodziewałem się więcej nawet po koncerniaku którego pils jest bardzo dobry. Nie warto.

Barwa ciemnobrunatna. Aromat palonego słodu, lekko słodki, całkiem złożony. W smaku zaskakująca pełnia, ponownie palone słody i przyjemny lekko czekoladowy finisz. Jak na koncern to naprawdę nie jest źle
Reddish dark color with tan head, aroma of roasted malts, brown sugar and dark chocolate, taste is the same, lighly sweet, medium bitter, medium body, average carbonation.

Color casi negro, con reflejos granates, translúcida. Espuma beige claro de un dedo de espesor y escasa retención. Aroma a cereales ligeramente tostados, algo de café y ciruelas u otros frutos negros, incluso hierba fresca. Sabor a cereal, esta vez más tostado, más cafetoso y ahumado, ni rastro de las frutas ni la hierba aunque aparecen frutos secos, entre nueces y almendras, final amargo y seco. Textura entre acuosa y sedosa. Carbonatación media alta.

Kolor: Ciemnobrązowy, nieprzejrzysty, a w dobrym świetle rubinowy i klarowny. Piana: Ecru, obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, szybko obrączkuje. Zapach: Ciemne słody, lekka paloność. Smak: Lekko palony, kawa zbożowa, nuty słodowe, niska, palona goryczka. Wysycenie średnie, piwo jest trochę wodniste. Ogólnie całkiem fajnie się pije.
Niezłe piwo palone, lekko karmelowe i słodowe, solidna pianka mała koronka, fajny dark lager

Lager Oscura Checa. A la vista es de color marrón-negro con destellos rojizos y opacos. Espuma poco densa y poco persistente de color canela. En nariz encontramos aroma de intensidad media a corteza de pan tostado y suave aroma herbal-terroso procedente del lúpulo y aroma a ciruela procedente de la fermentación. En boca es ligera-refrescante con gusto a malta tostada, suave amargor y final de chocolate con leche. Una cerveza disfrutable a cualquier hora del día.
Nice and crisp for a dark roasty lager. Brewed to the classic style perfectly, relatively light body. D&S dresden
amaro da leggero a medio, caffè torrefatto, dolcezza leggera, gusto metallico strano, corpo medio, finitura di malto tostato

Pours very dark and on the reddish side.. Smells grainy, taste is a malty but fairly dry lager witha  bit of chocolate. Not much in the way of sweetness, just a dark grainy aftertaste. A medium bodied but refreshing beer.
Keg at salthorse. Pours deep brown, nose is roasted, malty, cola, taste is sweet toffee, nutty, grassy, bready.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Keg, Salt Horse. Dark brown. Bubbly head  Malty aroma, some roast. It's pretty thin, both in mouthfeel and taste. Some roasted malt. Ok.
Piwo ciemne o beżowej pianie, pozostawia lacing. W aromacie lekka kawa, nieco wodniste ale pijalnie.

W aromacie słodowo, słodko, czuć karmel, trochę suszone śliwki, rodzynki, w tle też nieco czekoladowo. Ale równolegle do tego czeski chmiel, który nie do końca do tego pasuje, i leciutka ścierka, żelazowość. Mimo to jest nieźle. Wyglad to czarna barwa, nieprzejrzysta, spora, gęsta kremowa piana, dość szybko znika ale zostawia lacing. W smaku od razu spore wysycenie, średnia pełnia, dość kwaskowe, palone, słodyczy już mniej niż w aromacie, ale trochę karmel i ciemny słód czuć. Aroma-9/12
Appearance-2/3
Flavor-17/20
Mouthfeel-4/5
Overall Impression-8/10
Total-40/50

风格：Czech Dark Lager
酒精度：4.7%vol
原麦汁浓度：11.9°P
灌装日期：2017.02.28

饮用日期：2017.10.02
饮用温度：6℃-9℃

香气：刚入杯有一些日光臭。显著的深色麦芽气息，带一些面包皮、太妃糖、烤焦气息，但并不发腻，细细闻来，的确有复杂度，较低的酒花药草、泥土气味在适饮温度下并不明显（超低温下明显很多），轻微的硫磺味。

外观：接近黑色的深棕色酒体，倾斜酒液，边缘呈深琥珀色，感觉较为干净；酒头为细腻的浅褐色，挂壁良好但不很浓厚持久。

风味：中等稍偏下的酒花苦度感受最为直接，酒花风味为较低的辛香；麦芽味中等、较为充实复杂，有太妃糖、面包皮风味，捎带一点焦苦，作为背景，并不甜腻。适饮温度下麦芽与酒花苦配合复杂而平衡。

口感：酒体中等，杀口感中上偏强、刺激感明显，包含了深色麦芽的多种风味与酒花苦味平衡，整体偏干不甜腻，但较为顺滑。

总体印象：一款风格标杆的捷克深色拉格，虽然是绿瓶包装受到了日光臭影响，但整体风味依然复杂而平衡，并没有减弱太多，体现了经典啤酒风格的魅力！如果保存条件良好，此款酒一定是风格世界级的体现。

建议饮用温度8℃-10℃。

330 ml bottle into lager glass, best before 4/13/2016. Pours crystal clear very dark brown color with a 1 finger dense and fluffy light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, brown sugar, toasted dark bread, herbal, wood, grass, light smoke/nuts, and roast/toasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roast/bready malt and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, brown sugar, toasted dark bread, herbal, wood, grass, light smoke/nuts, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy hop and roast bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, brown sugar, toasted dark bread, herbal, wood, grass, smoke, nuts, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great hop/roasted bitter/sweet balance, and zero acrid/astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from hop/roast bitterness. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, bready/grainy, and fairly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.7%. Overall this is a delicious schwarzbier! All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, and easy to drink with the balanced bitter/drying finish. Amazingly flavorful with great balanced malt complexity for the low ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Aroma is in line with a properly made dunkel - roasty, light caramel tones, hints of chocolaty sweetness with grassy hop undertones. Big silken chew on malts, roasty, toasty, cocoa tones, finish goes dry with bright saaz bittering and black patent malt charred grain astringency. Great dry dunkel. Satisfying, flavorful and a utilitarian match for many foods.

Color marrón muy oscuro-negro, espuma nula sin adherencia. Malta maltoso tostado moderado, ésteres a regaliz, frutos negros, ciruela, lúpulo frutal-terroso bajo-nulo. En boca malta maltoso tostado moderado-moderado bajo, ésteres a frutos negros, ciruela, mentol, notas cenizas, lúpulo frutal-terroso bajo-nulo, lúpulo de amargor nulo, mineralidad. Final fresco con notas cenizas sin astringencia, cuerpo bajo, buena carbonatación.

Cerveja marrom-escura, com espuma bege de boa formação e persistente até o fim. Aroma de pão, levemente tostado (mas sem presença de café), um toque cítrico. Sabor acompanha o aroma: malte, grãos, pão, levemente doce, lúpulo bem suave dando apenas um toque final. Corpo leve pra médio, bem interessante, com carbonatação média. Final suave, sem amargor, com drinkabilidade imensa. Bem saborosa e equilibrada.

Po otwarciu butelki wydobywa się zapach kawy zbożowej. Barwa trunku jest ciemna ale przejrzysta. Piana jest gruba koloru beżowego. Smakuje kawą z cukrem czuć trochę karmelu. Niskie wysycenie co jest dla mnie ogromnym plusem. Przy następnej okazji na pewno spróbuję jeszcze raz.
[Butelka 28.02.2018] Czarna barwa i brązowa obfita piana. W aromacie karmel, smak palony, słodowy. Nawet znośny "tmavy lezak".

Draft at the Cafe Kafka in Prague The beer poured a dark black color with a long lasting tan head. The aroma of sweet roasted malt greets you. The beer has a medium body with soft-average carbonation. The beer has a clean finish with caramel closing the swallow.

4. 4. 2017, 200 bar, Ljubljana. Nothing extra, mainly OK, but really average beer with average taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Barwa ciemnobrunatna, przejrzyste. Ładna piana, dość trwała. Aromat: słodowy, palony, kawa. W smaku lekko słodkawe, lekko szmaciane. Wysycenie raczej niskie, goryczka niska, ale przyjemna. Kremowa konsystencja, mało ciała, pijalne.

Aroma - pleasant, with lot of roasted malt, some burnt malt, dried black fruits and dark chocolate. Taste - a very good combination of roasted malt and a softly allusion of dry stout, with some burnt malt and smoked black fruits, a bit of dark chocolate (without bitterness). Very good and balanced.

Pour from an 11.2oz bottle.Clear dark brew with amble head, great head retention and excellent lacing. Nice aroma of toasted grain, roasted nuts, slight floral hops notes. Taste is moderately sweet malt up front, emerging toast, roasted grain, and nuts. Fnishes with a mild hops flourish that offsets most of the sweetness. A very solid brew.
500 ml bottle served in mug. Dark brown colour, bright brown small foam head. Smoke, roasted malt, dark chocolate aroma. Bitter with malty hint. Soft carbonated. Thin texture, medium body.

2017/03/14 - Pours a dark brown colour with a foamy, khaki head that quickly reduces and leaves minimal, spotty lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, molasses and bready notes. Taste is much of the same; bready, toasted malt, coffee, residual sugar and earthy hops. Mouthfeel is medium to full with smooth carbonation and a lightly bitter, toasted malty finish. Not bad. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This dark lager poured a deep black colour with a beautiful tan head. Unfortunately, green bottles, far off land and fluorescent lighting at the lcbo equal skunk. Minimal lacing. Scents include coffee, molasses and dark toast. First swig was a little thin but had nice roasted flavour. Expected a nice creamy mouthfeel. Pretty good nonetheless.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

APARIENCIA: de color marrón profundo con algunos destellos rojizos y cafés a contraluz; corona de espuma color beige de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: muy marcadas las maltas tostadas con notas a café, chocolate y algo ligeramente terroso, nueves, algo mineral del agua y herbal de los lúpulos pero muy ligero.

SABOR: nuevamente las maltas tostadas destacan, café chocolate y algo ligeramente terroso, atrás algo de nueces siguiéndole lo mineral del agua y ligeramente herbal de los lúpulos nobles utilizados. En el retrogusto queda un amargor ligero alto, seco y no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero, mediana carbonatación.
dark brown colour with thick tanned head, aroma of roasted malt, taste is roasted wit hints of coffee and cocoa.
0,33l fles in servie bij little bay. Zwart met een dunne creme kraag. Licht gebrande moutsmaak verder niets eigenlijk

I bought this bottle during a promotion in Denner in Prilly-Malley. I drank for the Birthday of my wife. In my opinion, it is an average Dunkel beer not extraordinary but not bad. The color is a dark brown
body, thin brown foam. The carbonation is a bit lower than a lager. The taste is light, malty, a bit roasted, hop and if I compare with the Bavarian sisters, this one has a dry finish, easy to drink even during the summer, pleasant and simple.

Wygląd - przejrzyście ciemne, piana utrzymująca się, grube pęcherzyki. Aromat paloność, karmel, ogólnie słodko, kawa i niestety chyba dicacetyl, mokra szmata. Odczucie w ustach - słodkość ma wysokim poziomie, fajna kawa, słody palone lecz też wyraźna szmatka cały czas się przebija. Gorączką niska, w stylu, wysycenie dość wysokie.

Aroma of diacetyl, carmel, coffee. Taste coffee, pleasurable carmel and some herbs in the background. I don’t taste any bitterness. Pleasurable beer, but nothing special. 
Pl:
Aromat diacetylu, karmelu i kawy. W smaku podobnie - całkiem przyjemny karmel, kawa, trochę nut ziołowych w tle. Goryczka niewyczuwalna. Całkiem przyjemne piwo.

Sampled from bottle at the 2016 Czech Heritage Fest in a footed pilsener glass, an opaque dark brown colour with sudsy tan foam and a little lace. Similar to Praga Dark, but better in every way: malty, bready, toasty, still more residual sweetness than I’d like, but not cloying or syrupy, a hint of earthy/floral hops, and higher carbonation. Medium-full body, bigger mouthfeel than I expected, lingering malty aftertaste. Interesting, very different overall from regular original Budweiser.
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer
Szép tiszta barna szín. Illatában a karamell és a kávé illata fedezhető fel. Testes, nem túl szénsavas. Finoman keserű.

Green bottle poured a clear dark reddish brown with a smalllasting tan head. Aromas of roastiness, licorice, coffee and cocoa. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of roastiness, licorice, coffee, cocoa and light dried fruit with a smooth lingering roasty cocoa finish.

Bottle. Dark Brown (almost Coke-like) in colour. Malty; roasted malts, buttery caramel, liquorice, coffee, chocolate. Hoppy; grassy hops. Roasted butter-malty sweetness offset by Saaz hop bitterness. Dry bitter hop finish. Smooth. Drinkable. (2011-06-29)

bottle BB 30.10.2017 - perhaps a less than 3 months old, which is more than decent. pours clear dark brown, dark red tint, with a very creamy beige head offering good retention and lacing. gently browned caramel malts, small berries, purple pulp, very chalky, grassy and peppery old world hops, clean tmavé flavors. moderate carbonation, light body - never thin; semi-sweet and smooth grassy finish. surprisingly fresh and not linear either.
Leicht phenoles Näschen, ein nett angesweeteter Samttrunk und viel Charakter, zumindest für ein Industriebier, sind eine echte Überraschung.A Gift from Enti...👄

Dense, beige head and coke like, clear colour. Some diacetyl, caramel and coffee in aroma. In taste there’s coffee, caramel and hint of herbs. A little sour finish. Not much bitterness. Body is full, carbonation rather low. If you want to know how Dark Czech Lager should taste like, definitely try this one. It’s decent dark beer.

A colablack beer, a head is quite big and beige. Aroma has sweetness of syrup, also balancing roastiness. Taste has maltyness, some roastiness, luckily only decent sweetness. Almost medium bodied, quite smooth. Quite balanced and not too sweet beer.

Pours a dark ruby red, nearly opache with a bubbly beige head. Aroma has notes of grains, toffee, and coffee. Tasting notes include lively malts, burnt grains, coffee, and sightly astringent finish. Not bad.

From notes. Enjoyed at Brot & Spiele at dinner with Gary. 500 mL bottle. The pour is a darker brown color with a hefty bit of ruby shining through. There is a thin light tan head that fades quickly, leaving a few spots of lace. The aroma is full of roasty malts right up front. This is nothing like I was expecting. There is a light licorice and a very bready presence. Surprising. The flavor is much of the same. It’s roasty and crisp with a nice bready character to it. There is a hint of licorice, but this all just fades off so quickly. The mouth feel is really watery and light with a decent carbonation and a lingeringly sweet and roasty finish. I like it. A lot more than I thought I would.

bottle. Poured dark, reddish-brown with a creamy tan head. Roasted malt aroma. Medium body, pricky carbonation, a bit oily. Typical roasty malt flavour, notes of coffee, smoke, dark fruit, treacle. Slight astringent finish.

Pours a nice 2 finger thick frothy tan head and has a fairly dark amber appearance with ruby highlights. Lively carbonation. Aromas of roasted malts, hints of coffee and very faint resin hints. Flavours are mostly the same as aromas, lots roasted malt notes, some sweet malts, notes of raisins of other similar dry fruits. Fairly smooth and slick sensation on the palate. Big bubbly mouthfeel, somewhat fizzy as well. Very good.

500 ml bottle. Dark reddish brown colour, small head mostly lasting, little lacing, soft carbonation. Nose is roasted malt, coffee, some liquorice. Flavour is less sweet than expected, nicely balanced bitterness, a bit watery. Leaves a smokey aroma in the aftertaste. An OK beer, nothing special.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Pours an opaque deep brown colour with one finger of lasting head. Lacing clinging to the side of the glass. Aromas of roasted malts and bread. Taste matches the aroma with espresso finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Piwo ciemno brunatne z rubinowymi refleksami, klarowne. Piana ładna, obfita, jasno beżowa, drobna i dosyć trwała, ładnie oblepia szkło. Aromat ciemnych słodów, słodkawy, niezbyt intensywny. W smaku słodkawe, jest niska goryczka, subtelne nuty karmelu i palonych słodów. Średnio nasycone i nieźle pijalne.

Pours a dark brown colour with copper and ruby highlights. Nice creamy beige head, long lasting with some creamy lacing. Roasted malt aromas with lots of molasses coming out. Hints of nuts, coffee and chocolate. The taste is milder with some dark grain notes, but overall watered-down with very light dark fruits. Some coffee tart. Overall refreshing dark brew.

Bottle from Beersquare, Santiago. Pours a murky dark brown with a medium gray head that leaves a good lacing. Aroma is malty, toasty with a huge rye bread profile. Notes of rye, toasted bread, roasted grains, tar, even a bit of charcoal, burnt grass and burnt wood. Taste tends to a sweet but roasty side, perfect balance, elegant woody and earthy hints under a prevailing rye bread and whole grain bread flavor. Delicious. Medium body. High carbonation. A complex dark lager indeed. Probably the best Dunkel I’ve tried.
Dark body white head. Sweet grainy malty aroma. Molasses dried fruit. Taste is quite sweet. Grainy. Not complex or interesting but okay.
Decent black lager, malty drinkable stuff. Imported to Canada. Dark bodied though on lighter bodied side.

Butelka. Barwa brunatna, z rubinowymi refleksami. Piana drobna, obfita, zdobi szk?o. Aromat s?odowy, lekko karmelowy. W smaku lekko kwaskowate, goryczka palonego s?odu, na poziomie niskim. Piwo ?rednio nasycone, pijalne.

Aroma: cork of dark bread, burnt malt.
Appearance: dark color, brown head.
Taste: malt bitterness, burnt malt.
Palate: middle body, high carbonation.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi

500 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a dark, slightly reddish, brown with average-sized light tan head. Aroma is toasted grains, coffee and wet straw. Flavour is dry, roasted grains, hints of coffee and a damp straw note. Body on the lighter side of medium. Ok.

A very dark red-brown, almost black. Foamy, light brown head. Chocolate, cola, and molasses on the nose. A sweet start (cola again) with a drier finish. Aroma has slightly roasted malts, fair nuts, bread, slight licorice, faint notes of green coffee beans. Taste is slightly sweet up front, with a well balanced dose of bitterness. Thinner than i expected, and with very low carbonation.

From the 500ml bottle it pours almost black with a mocha coloured head. Soft grassy sweet-dry-sour aroma. Taste caramelly and bready malts with a small edge of roasty dryness, fresh bready sourness. Chocolate emerges. Saaz are classic noble with delicate bitterness and sweet grass and faintly lemony. Very poised medium palate. Munich Caramel and Roasted malts in description agree with my assessment, I’m guessing all legit ingredients no fake malt extract here yes? Better than I expected, cool addition the LCBO!

500ml bottle. Dark mahogany brown with a frothy beige head. Flavors are bready/roasted cereals, burnt toast, molasses and toffee with fruity and light herbal notes. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Out of the bottle, poured a very deep brown/espresso colour, translucent, with a thin off-white head. I got aromas of roasted malts, molasses, chocolate, coffee, dried fruits (like chocolate covered raisin) and wafer. On the palate, repeats of chocolate (more like sweet milk chocolate) and coffee with a relatively short lager finish. Very enjoyable dark lager. Will definitely try again.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 



App.: Deep brown-black with a fairly full light mocha head.
 
Aroma: Light to moderate roasted malt, fairly clean, a bit of boiled cereal, no hop aroma to speak of.
 
Palate: Medium body, moderate+ carbonation.
 
Flav.: Light to moderate roasted notes, clean, a bit of wet cardboard; dry with medium-low bitterness and a clean, roasted finish.



Probably a bit nicer fresh. Certainly a clean lager with apparent roasted malts.

500ml bottle. Pours almost black with a mocha coloured head. On the nose, lots of roasted malt notes, light cocoa, faint dark roast coffee, and a bit of straw. Taste wise, raisin, cocoa, a very faint note of tartness, dark roast coffee and darker malts that heads into lots of dry roasty malt notes, more of the coffee, with light bitterness in the long finish. A total pleasant surprise, and for what it cost, it’s a bargain. Thumbs up!

Aroma of roasted caramel, some dark malts and something sour. Dark, but not black, medium beige head, some lacing. Correctly. Taste is dry, grilled bread, maybe coffee. Roastiness bitter, but on the medium level or even below. Quite watery, easy to drink. Medium body and low sweetness. For me, very similar to german Schwarzbier. A good dark lager, but I’ve drunk better.

Opaque black with a mid sized beige head that retains itself for quite some time. Pleasant pungence consisting of mild roast, dark chocolate, caramel and malt. Light bodied and bubbly. Appeasing flavour containing smoke, roast, chocolate, and malt, with a slight hop and smoke present in the finish. Emphatically smokey and rather nice.

Cobre-oscuro casi negro con tintes granates, limpia. Espuma con buena persistencia, de color canela. Aroma a maltas tostadas, nuez, chocolate, café y ligeras notas a frutos negros, lúpulo moderado-bajo especiado. Maltosa rica en productos de Maillard, notas a café y algo de regaliz. Bien balanceada. De cuerpo y carbonatacion media.
En god mørk øl, der har en smag af mørke malte. Ikke meget humle i den, men en god nydeøl.
Bottle - Dark toasty malts with some cocoa. Deep brown with a rich beige head. Dark and sweet malty molasses. Long finish. Tons of brown sugar and molasses.

Appearance: clear deep brown with one finger of loose ivory head diminishing gradually to a thin cap, moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: toasted malt, caramel, chocolate, slightly smoky. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter. (7/10) Medium body, lively to moderate carbonation, medium duration off-dry mildly bitter finish. (3/5)

Gotta say, this is actually quite decent. Refreshing and relatively light despite its dark appearance. Worth trying. (14/20)

500ml Bottle. Pours a very dark reddish amber (but not hazy) with a thin brown head. Aroma of malt, notes of caramel and chocolate. Light but continuous carbonation. Taste is malty, but not sweet. Notes of coffee, a bit roasty. Light hop notes, kind of saaz-like. Moderate mouthfeel. Finish is bitter, with more saaz notes, some herbs, a bit earthy. Overall pretty decent for a Dunkel, basic but a good example of the style.
Zdecydowanie gorsze od jasnego Budweisera. Ciemno-brunatna barwa, w smaku lekka goryczka, chlebowość, typowy dunkel.
Donkerbruin, ondoorzichtig bier met beige kraag. Vlak en waterig. Niet complex. Koffie, mout, appel, karamel. Zoet, bitter, licht zuur.
0,5l bottle. Pours black with medium sized beige head. Some roasted malts, caramel and sugar. Light bitterness and sweetness.
barwa ciemna bronzowa, piana obfita sredniooczkowa. Aromat przypieczony karmel, skorka od chleba, deliaktny skunks. Smak czoc wyrazna slodowosc, goryczka niska, wysycenie ok

330 mml bottle tasted on the 15/08/2016. Dark red brown colour with a frothy white head. Aroma of roasted malts and burnt malts. Taste is burnt malts, some caramel and lots of roasted malts. Aftertaste is medium dry and watery. Next one please!
0.5 l can. Had this one before joining RateBeer, therefore this entry is only based on numerical notes.

Drank in astronomical quantities during Brutal Assault Festival 2016. Definitely my favorite one in the Budvar: B family. I found myself in love with czech dark beers so that’s probably why, but this is clearly a interesting beer. Smooth but always present taste of coffee, chocolate and a delicate head that pleases every sense. Very refreshing overall, i really recommend this one to any dark beer amateur. APPROVED BY TAVERNY’S BLACK METAL CREW!

Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is malts, metal, something sour, basil, eggs, some cream. Taste is metal, smoked and grilled bread, a bit over burnt pork, some oil, copper, steel. Metallic after taste. Drinkable.

Hyvin tummanruskea olut tiiviillä, beigellä vaahdolla, joka häipyy vähitellen. Tuoksussa karamellisuutta. Sopivasti hiilihappoinen. Maussa makeista maltautta, hieman kahvia. Lyhyehkö, hieman katkera jälkimaku. Ei vetinen suutuntuma. Varsin mainio tumma lager Tsekeistä.

Bottle. Color: Very dark brown, almosr black. Light brown head. Taste: Bittersweet, roasted malts. Hints of chocolate, coffee. Not as watery as most of the other Czech dark beers and that’s definitely a plus for this beer.

33 cl bottle served in red wine glass. Pours blackest bright black with greyish foamy head. Aroma is dark berries: blackberry, bilberry. Also cola nut and espresso coffee. Taste is fresh, slightly sour, not noticeably bitter. Abrupt finish. Nice simple one.

Bottle. Dark brown, medium tan head. Aroma malts, hints of caramel. Medium body. Taste sweet, mainly caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Barwa ciemnobrązowa, z przebłyskami, piana w kolorze złamanej bieli, dość obfita, ale niezbyt trwała. W aromacie słodowość, lekki DMS się niestety pojawia, lekka paloność. W smaku dość wytrawne, palone, nieco kawowe, ciemne słody, goryczka średnia nawet minimalnie w kierunku wysokiej, palona. Treść i wysycenie w normie, dobra pijalność. Nawet niezłe, bardziej przypomina jednak Szwarzbiera. Gdyby nie dość słaby aromat, byłoby nieźle, tak jest przeciętnie z plusem.
0,5 bottle. Pours dark brown color with small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, coffee and smoked wood. Medium bitterness. Drinkable.
Can. Dark brown colour, medium taned head. Aroma is roasted malt, bread and some coffee. Taste malt and caramel. Good beer.
Вкусное темное пиво, хорошо сбалансированное по вкусу, приятный аромат, послевкусие с горчинкой.

Bottle. Dark brown in colour with strong carbonation. Aromas are of slightly fruity lager yeast, minerals, and roasted malts. Flavors are of sweet pilsner malt, coffee, ash, and more mild fruit. No caramel notes, and not overly sweet. Decent overall, and likely very food friendly (especially with grilled meats).

500 ml bottle. As Czechvar B:Dark. Pours a very dark brown with light white head. Aromas of dry dusty chocolate and dry roasted malts. Flavors of dark burnt sugar, roasted malts and nutty dry chocolate. Tasty and refreshing
Nice creamy head. A lot of caramel, some dark bread. Light body, medium carbonation.

Tasted on 24.01.16. Pleasant but not very intensive aroma of caramel. Small head disappearing to ring. Almost completely black colour. Pleasant sweetness of caramel and burned malts. Light but enjoyable.

Obfita i dosyć gęsta, beżowa piana. Brązowe, klarowne piwo. Lacing. W aromacie kawa i trochę jakiejś słodyczy. Średnie nagazowanie. Świetna, wyraźna goryczka - pierwszy raz spotykam taką w tmavym. Piwo średnio pełne, wydaje się dosyć gładkie. W smaku raczej wytrawne. Kawa, orzechowe, troszkę karmelu. Smak niby fajny, ale mało intensywny.
tap @ BA festival (czech) brown colour, medium body, normal carbonated, caramel, roasted malt
W smaku i zapachu karmelowe,palone z lekką nutą chmielową, mocno pijalne, przyjemne,niewadliwe choć też nie powala. Średniak

500ml bottle. Very dark brown pour with a creamy smooth two finger tan head. Aroma is very smoky, with sweet fruity malts. Taste is again very smoky, roasted malt, caramel, bit of coffee maybe. Leaves a smoky aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel. Too much smokiness for my liking but otherwise good.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt and caramel. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, yeast, grain, and a bit of chocolate. Easy to drink. On the sweet side.
11.2 oz single bottle from Wilbur’s Total Beverage. Dark brown appearance with a tan head. Skunky, dark malty lager with moderate sweetness. Average body with a smooth, creamy feel. Drinkable.

Dark ruby, almost black pour with medim beige head. Smell is mostly roasted malts and smoke.

Medium body with subtle carbonation. Texture is between watery and oily. Bittersweet taste. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and some nuts. Smoked aftertaste. 

Overall, it’s a nice beer. Nothing special, but tasty and refreshing.

0,5l can. Dark brown colour with medium lasting brown head. Aroma: caramel, light coffee. Taste: sweet malty start with sour pale lager caracters. Hiding light bitterness. Quite watery. Light body with lively carbonation. Watery average finish. Maybe the bottled version is better.

Bottle bought in BC Liquor store. Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, hops, roasted malt, notes of chocolate. Body is very light (like it should be). In the taste: roasted malt, caramel, dark bread, notes of dark fruits and roasted coffee. Burnt malt bitterness aftertaste. Very good, classic Czech lezak.
Found in a different label with the Czechvar Dark predominant. A dark lager that was smooth. Nothing outstanding but I found it enjoyable. Looked like a stout but the head didn’t stay around long.
Bottle from Co-op, Hebden Bridge. Very dark reddish-brown with a bubbly head. Includes some tasty enough smooth dark malts. Not overly flavoursome, but not bad.

500 ml bottle. Clear dark cola colour, mostly lasting fine tan foam. Aroma is roasty, caramel, nutty. Taste is light roast, caramel, nutty, slight tart tang, faint Noble influence. Average carbonation, medium bodied, lightly hopped. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary) 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown, big tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Roasted flavour, medium to high long lasting bitterness. Good.

Very watery dark tmave lager form the Czech Republic. A generic example of the style. Lacks the maltiness and the slightly sweet dark chocolate, toffee notes, typical of this style. The a burnt flavour comes through more strongly than it should
Good example of the commercial dark beer but in Czech Republic we have much better tmave pivo

Pours dark brown with a red hint. Nose is malty. Taste is strong malt and molasses sweetness. Decent brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Poured clear dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Medium toasted malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium dark sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of average duration. This beer met my expectations.

On tap at Beer Republic.
Thin creamy off white head. Clear black pour. Very refreshing.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- bottled 7/31/15 - Clear dark ruby brown color, beige head that drops to a solid cover, stringers of lace. Aroma of light malt. Taste is heavy dark malt that adds a tongue-tingling burst of carbonation on the swallow, then moving to a lightly hopped finish. Heavy and one-dimensional, making me wonder if it is past it’s "best by" date.
From Hipercor. In Ikea’s pilsner glass. After dinner. Pleasant in all aspects. I only miss a bit more "punch" to consider it excellent.
0,5 bottle. Pours dark brown color with small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, coffee and smoked wood. Medium bitterness. Drinkable.

Intensywny aromat kawowy, lekko palony, dosyć przyjemny. Kolor ciemnobrunatny, klarowne. Piana beżowa, wysoka, średniopęcherzykowa, szybko opada do cienkiej warstwy, delikatnie zdobi szkło. W smaku wytrawne, palona kawa, słodowe. Niska, popiołowa goryczka i wysokie wysycenie. Można wypić lekko schłodzone w upalny dzień.

Pours in black with light brown large head. Aroma of wood, roast, smoke, chocolate. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour.medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, burned long finish. Very drinkable dark beer,

500ml can served in a pint glass.
A: Pours a dark brown color forming a medium, creamy and fizzy head that dissipates quickly leaving some lingering molasses lacings in the glass.
S: Notes is roasted and biscuity. Notes of ashes. Hints of dark chocolate. Flowery and grassy hops finish. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of roasted malts, Oreo, ashes, crispy malts, dark chocolate. Mild hops bitterness. Grassy hops profile. Strong Lager character yeasts, very biscuity. 
M: Light to medium body. Good carbonation. Roasted malts and Oreo biscuit in the aftertaste. Hints of dark chocolate. 
O: Medium drinkability. No bad.
From can. Pours clear dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of grains, light roasty notes, toast, very light butter. Taste is light roasty, nuts, hints of chocolate, a hint of butter, not much to it.
Can. Pours very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of malts, pilsner malts, grainy, very light roast. Taste us grain, light caramel, light bread light metal. Decent.

50 cl bottle from Kaufland, served in a tulip. Dark brown, clear, with medium, tan, long lasting head. Aroma is roasted malts, light toasted, earthy, faint hoppy. Body is medium, carbonation is soft. Taste is medium sweet, low to medium bitter, texture is watery to oily.
Bottle, I think picked up at the foreign foods shop in Cricklewood. Dark brown in colour, ruddy. Quite dry, ashy bitterness, clean palate. Pleasant but nothing overly exciting.
toast, medium bitterness, thin feel, astringent. A bit disappointing. I’ve had store-brand dark lagers that were more drinkable than this.

Bottle - Clear dark reddish brown colour, medium sized beige head with average retention. Roasted malt aromas, some chocolate, red fruits, some flowery hops. Taste is sweet malty, some caramel, chocolate, flowery and herbal hops. Light to medium body, average carbonation, dry roasted finish. A good dark lager.
Nie je to zlé, ale rozhodne som pil lep?ie po chvílke stráca chu? ?o je celkom ?koda preto?e vô?a je super

Bursztynowo-rubinowe klarowne, drobna piana ecru, zostaje obrączka tylko. Aromat karmel, nuty kawy, smak wytrawny, zaznaczona goryczka, lekka palonosc na finiszu. Wysokie nasycenie. Spodziewałem się nudnego tmave a jest raczej schwartz...

Faint aroma of roasted malts. Very dark, almost black, (but perhaps it was the light). Thin but lingering creamy head. Light to medium-bodied. Mild and nicely balanced taste - this is a pleasant and thought out beer, if a bit too unobtrusive. Refreshing, and leaves you ready to open the next one.
7.11.2015-bottle-0,5l. rötlich-dunkelbraun mit großer beiger Schaumkrone. Gute Karbonisierung. Aroma Röstmalz/ Kaffee. Antrunk Schokolade, Kaffee, Röstmalz - leicht säuerlich. ok.

On tap at Highlander Pub (Ottawa, ON). Black body with brown glints and a thin beige creamy head. Good malty aroma with hoppy and chocolate hints. Its well balanced malty/hoppy taste carries chocolate and nutty notes. Ends with a decent bittersweet finish. Good example of Tmavý.

* Bottle. Pours black, with tan head. 
* Aroma is strong, roasted malt, chocolate & coffee. 
* Palate is medium body, medium carbonation, very fine bubbles. 
* Taste is thin, medium, roasted malt, chocolate & coffee. 
* Finish is refreshing, then slightly drying. 
* Overall thin, medium, roasted malt, chocolate & coffee.

Bottled. A very dark red-brown, almost black. Foamy, light brown head. Chocolate, cola, and molasses on the nose. A sweet start (cola again) with a drier finish. Surprising light, not the thick mouthfeel I was expecting. Very drinkable.

labeled as Czechvar here in the USA - quite a dark brew, darker than i expected. malty and toasty, clean with a good balance. not overly sweet despite the malt aroma, and very well put-together. excellent brew, well executed for the style.

Pours very dark brown with a huge tanned head that disappears quite fast. Aroma; Roasted malt, chocolate and some coffee. Flavours; some malt, coffe and chocolate tones and a watery flavour thru all the taste palette. You can actually drink it like water during a workout
Intense dark color, dry, soft-caramel tart flavor without the predominance of sweetness. Beer exudes subtle aroma of roasted malt
From tap at 17s Bar in Bratislava with TO 06.10.15. Black. Pale brown head and lacing. Moderate aroma of dark chocolate and roasted malt. Similar taste, with burnt caramel. Good drinkability.

(tap 0,5l @ Brewery)

Aroma: Light roasted, sweet, caramel.

Appearance: Dark black color. Long lasting, beige head.

Taste: Medium sweet, light caramel, light roasted.

Palate: Medium body. Dry finish.

Overall: Average malty dark lager.
Ciemny kolor prawie nieprzezroczysty z brazowa obfita i lekko palona piana ktora utrzymuje sie calkiem dlugo. Karmelowe nuty i palony chmiel byloby lepsze gdyby nie lekki metaliczny posmak.
50 cl bottle and then on tap.Dark colour and medium off white head.Light caramel and roasted flavour.A good tmavy
Bottle. Pitch bpack with small brown head. Weak sweet aroma of malts. Sweet taste of malts and caramel.
Very good dark lager,,, nice dark colour with solid foam,, taste is good for lager,, very drinkable when you thursty, nice refreshing beer,, i highly recomended
Not my favorite style of beer but it’s an interesting taste. Its more of a porter than lager. Beutiful smell and appearance.

Pours a dark brown color, coppery undertone, topped with a medium sized and solidly lasting tan colored head. Caramel malt aroma, slight roasty and coffee feel. Taste starts sweet and malty, caramle with some very gentle bitterness in the finish. Well balanced, a bit soury grassy feel to it. Drinkable and nicely enjoyable.

Bottle 33cl. Clear deep ruby brown color, large frothy beige head, mostly lasting, good lacing; aroma sweet malts, roasted, caramel, coffee, cocoa; taste light to medium sweet and bitter, malty, coffee and chocolate notes; light body, oily to watery texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste mild sweetbitter, light chocolate, sugary notes; better than expected, still no high-flyer.
Musta väri, iso kahvimainen viipyvä vaahto. Tuoksuu kissan kuivamuonalle. Suutuntuma kuohuva, miedon vetinen, mutta jälkimaussa löytyy tukevuutta. Juotavaksi tehtyä.

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno brunatne z rubinowymi refleksami, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości, trwała. Ładny lacing

AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Zapach kawy zbożowej - karmel przemieszany z pumperniklem i zbożami. 
Nuty miodowe 
SMAK: Autentycznie to piwo przywodzi na myśl kawę zbożową z niewielką zawartością alkoholu. Goryczka niska, krótka.

OGÓLNIE: Nie mój styl, ale piwo dobre.

The beer has a very nice porter like appearance. Nice dark, little foam, delicious. The smell is great. There is a dark roasted barley aroma, together with a sweet fruity cherry aroma. I also smell Some coffee. Really delicious. The taste is almost devine. The beer has that heavenly roast smell, which I love. There are also touches of coffee and chocolate, really nice. There is also a hoppy citrusy thing going on. Very good.
Converting" from old excel scoresheet. So there is no comments on this beer.

Durable, creamy foam. Good aroma of roasted malt which most resembles classic dark mild ale. The flavor is deep full of roasted malt, light caramel and good hoppy aftertaste. Customize rich thirst-quenching properties with good balance between malt / hops.

0.5 bottle. Black color and a small, off-white head. Aroma of dark malts, coffee, and a delicate note of toast. Taste of caramel, again coffee, and dark chocolate; relatively bitter due to all that. Medium body, slick texture, and lively carbonation. Finish is even more coffee-like than the rest. Overall, not a bad beer given its commercial provenance.

Tuoksu on maltainen ja kahvinen. Väriltään samean tummaa, melkeinpä mustaa vaaleanruskealla vaahdolla. Maussa on katkeraa kahvisuutta, ruohoisuutta ja palanutta leipää, jotka pyöristyvät paahdetun pähkinän jälkimakuun. Tuo myös mieleen soijakastikkeen. Jälkimaku viipyilee pitkään.

Bebida na versão com o rótulo Czechvar apresentou líquido escuro,rubro quase negro,espuma marrom cremosa com bom volume e duração;no aroma malte tostado,lúpulos Saaz,café,ameixa,caramelo,especiarias;sabor segue o aroma,maltado e torrado,corpo leve,final levemente adocicado,boa carbonatação e drinkability . Lager escura equilibrada,gostosa e bem feita,uma das melhores do estilo.

Pour a somewhat clear mahogany brown, with a large foamy tan head. 
Aroma has slightly roasted malts, fair nuts, bread, slight licorice, faint notes of green coffee beans. 
Taste is slightly sweet up front, with a well balanced dose of bitterness. Watery bodied, with a rather flat carbonation.

0.5 bottle from Kauffland, Umag. Drank this before, only rating it now. Dark brown with reddish tint, small off white, almost tan head, lasts quite long. Pleasant aroma of roasted malts, wood, caramel, even dried fruits. Creamy, medium body, roasty bitterness, light carbonation, roasty finish. Not bad at all.

Ciemne, nieprzejrzyste piwo o obfitej pianie szybko redukującej się do zera. Aromat palonych słodów, kawowy. W smaku kawa zbożowa i lekka kwaskowość. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie całkiem przyjemne czeskie ciemne piwo, bez szaleństw, ale nie jest źle.

Can 0.5 l.  Dark Brown Beer with thick beige foam and superb retention. Nose - Caramel, liquorice - aroma - caramel malt, biscuit, liquorice and faint coffee. Fine balanced bitterness. A very nice dark larger

Bottle - Pours a clear, brown with a smallish head. Caramel and bread aromas. Aromas continue through the taste with sweet malts and somewhat cloying. Little carbonation, but that might be the age of the bottle. OK, but I like this style.
Dark brown body, lasting beige head. Aroma of burned bread. Taste has a medium bitterness, some roastiness, coffee-like nuances in the finish.
Can from Fakta. Pours black/dark brown with a good off-white head. Aroma and taste is sweet roasted malts, caramel, coffee. Soft carbonation. Dry roasted finish.
On tap. Dark brown with a medium tan head. malty and roasted tones. Malt, caramle, coffee and hops. Medium body with a dry / roasted finish.
500ml bottle. Pitch black body with a medium white head. Bready, with some roasted notes, grass and honey. Easy to drink.
500 ml bottle form TIv Taam, Tel Aviv . Dark and malty with chocolate notes. Some nutty flavor. Ok.

W aromacie głównie delikatna kawa zbożowa, trochę paloności i karmelu. Barwa: czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana: średnio-obfita. Wysycenie: wysokie. W smaku mało słodyczy, głównie ciemne słody podszyte kwaskowością i lekką goryczką. Kolejno piwo od Budweisera dobre jako orzeźwiacz na lato, którym niczym się nie wyróżnia. Poprawne, ale bez charakteru.

Muy oscura, casi negra. Abundante espuma beige. Aroma a chocolate, y algo de cola. Sabor a grano tostado y chocolate, bastante seco y con un cuerpo algo aguado. Bebible y agradable, con un postgusto de chocolate amargo.

50cl Bottle
 pours a dark brown with a tight beige head
 Aroma is very little bit of malt little else
 Taste is sourish malt bit of bitterness
 ok but this used to be much better
Tried on tap in the Czech Republic. Soft and mild on the palate but not especially exciting. Very subtle alcoholic flavours.

Butelka 0.5l. do 17.05.2016r. Barwa czarna, klarowna, Piana dosyć obfita i drobna, jednak szybko się redukuje. W aromacie czuć głównie estry. W smaku dominuje paloność i kawa zbożowa. Goryczka minimalna, nasycenie niskie. Nie czuć ciała piwa i jest jakieś ono takie bez wyrazu i zbyt lekkie. Jednak piwo jest pijalne. Za tę cenę (2.5zł) trudno znaleźć coś lepszego.
Ruby brown color, rich off-white but quicly falling down head, some lacing. Aroma of caramel and some roasty notes. Taste is smooth, caramel sweet with a hint of roastiness. A bit flat but drinkable.

L:
-pours a clear dark brown with ruby tinges and a big,frothy,beige head
S:
-very spicy.bready,grassy,slight caramel and slight roast
T:
-Follows the nose exactly with a more pronounced roastiness
F:
-light-medium body,low-medium carbonation
O:
A nice dark lager

Essayons une lager foncée, pour savoir s’il y a quelque chose de valable là-dedans …
4 malts dans la composition : on se foule pour pas grand chose !!
4,7 % abv au compteur, on ne va pas déraper !!
Couleur brun roux, à la clarté nette (normal).
Assez pétillante, on entend les bulles !!
Mousse beige moyen, assez jolie.
Arômes de malt cara, cassonade, pointe de miel brun.
1ère bouche douce, sympa, un peu style bière d’étudiant, à boire toute la nuit...
Arrière-bouche tout à fait aqueuse.
2ème qui ne casse pas une patte à une mouche, c’est gentillet.
Arrière-bouche sans ambition : un peu de sucre, un peu de malt.
3ème avec un peu de malt grillé, pointe de fumée (sûrement la cigarette de l’étudiant à côté).
Arrière-bouche quelconque.
Longueur qui descend constamment (normal).
Alcool inopérant sur l’ensemble (même sur mon voisin).
Finale ridicule.
CONCLUSION : une lager parmi d’autres, d’une banalité sans limite.

Bottle 0.5l. Deep red with medium beige head. Sweetish aroma of prune and date honey. Flavor of dried fruits, prune and carob, mild bitterness and some spiciness, a bit salty, semi-dry finish. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied.

Aroma: Tootsie roll chocolate, caramel, light roast, slight skunk. Appearance: Ruby dark brown with a foamy tan head that fades into a skin. Flavor: Matches the nose, especially with tootsie roll chocolate; caramel and roast hangs back, leading to a lightly bitter finish. Palate: Light body, sticky texture, very soft carbonation, long finish. Overall: A completely average beer for the style.

Bottle from Beers of Europe.

Pours dark brown, black, single finger tan coloured head. Very clear. Aroma of wheat, honey, grass, grain...Taste of initial dog biscuit...musky...very malty, toasted malts, then grain, some light hops...Ok.

Bottle. A strong malty aroma, a little bit sweet. The fizzy beige head is small with a normal duration. The body is nearly black. A nice malty taste with a light bitter finish. The body is light to medium strong, dry and creamy with a normal carbonation.
Color negro, con una buena capa de espuma. Aroma ligero algo tostado. Sabor con final tostado de café. Muy bebible para una Lager.
Dark, malty and roasty...slightly sweet and a hearty brew. Somewhat like a stout. Good stuff

Dark brown colored, medium weak tan non lasting head. Aroma is of caramel, Munich malt, roasted malt and somewhat sweet coffee. Taste is moderate sweet caramel, Munich malt, roasted malt with a chocolate-toasty finish and a bit of fruit somewhere in between, low on hops and bitterness. Low to medium bodied, watery texture, medium carbonation. Can’t shake the feeling that it left a stronger impression a few years ago but I still like the bugger!
Czech people know how to brew awesome dunkel lagers, indeed. Excellent beer with strong toasted notes, like coffee, wich glad remains for a while after drink.
Typical tmavy lezak aroma, nice long lasting head and a not-sweet, bitter taste. Not a bad beer, but there are a lot of better dark beers in thus price range.
Dark brown colour with almost no off-white head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, sugar. The same are flavours with too sweet taste in finish. Low carbonation and medium bitterness.

11.2 oz. bottle from Wilbur’s. Appearance: finger tan head, brown color, clear, good lacing. Aroma: roast, molasses, chocolate. Palate: medium light body, soft creamy texture, moderate bitter finish, creamy texture. Taste: sweet molasses with notes of roast and chocolate, finish is biscuity into floral hops. Overall, amazing for the style, very drinkable, nice beer.
pours clear dark brown with a creamy tan head, nice lacing. aroma leather, coffee, nuts, dark chocolate. creamy. light body, almost like pilsener. dry finish. a bit bland.
Flaska Bishops örebro. Svartbrun kulör. Sötaktig doft med rostade inslag. Smak av rostad malt, mörkt bröd och lite blött papper

Aroma ; caramel, chocolate.
Appearance ; dark brown, clear, tan foam, 
Taste : light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour.
Palate : light body, thin feel, soft carbonation.
Espuma entre beige y marrón que permanece como una fina corona, color marrón oscuro, aroma tostado en nariz, sabor dulce y tostado, muy suave, regusto agradable

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 4C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch A1. AROMA: roasted aroma with a background note that resembles DMS. No esters. APPEARANCE: very dark brown color with ruby highlights. translucent. medium tanned head with below average retention. TASTE: roasted flavour with some faint coffe notes. low bitterness and a clean lager profile. finishes semi-dry. no hop flavours. PALATE: light body with moderate carbonation. OVERALL: a dark lager that lacks some bitterness and body.
16.5.2014. Dark brown colour, dark malts, slight dunkel sweetness. Taste is also malty, some bitterness.

500 ml bottle, clear dark brown color with medium late head. smells like roast malts and some barley. the taste are classic for dunkel nice roast malt with some kind caramel and toffee sweetness, aftertaste are medium in term but has nice feeling of roast malt with some kind milky chocolate sweetness and a little oak taste. fine beer no notes of alcohol, carbon is ok and not to watery.
OK øl, men samtidig noget ordinær. Dejlig smag. Men denne øl mangler alligevel noget...

Bottle 0,5l. Clear, brown colored beer. Aroma of roasted malt, little coffee, maybe chocolate. Light body, but not watery, flavor is smooth, dry, tones of roasted malt, moderately bitter.
 An average dark lager.

Bottle 0,5l. Dark brown body, medium light brown head. Low aroma of nuts and chocolate. Taste is medium dry, slightly bitter. Roasted, grainy, nutty, tones of coffee, chocolate. Medium body and carbonation.
A common dark beer, nothing special.

Mély barna szín, egy ujjnyi paplanszer? hab. Karamellás kezdet csokis folytatás végén enyhén el?kerülnek a pörkölt jegyek is. Szénsavassága belesimul, könnyedén csúszik egy kissé lehetne testesebb. Ár-érték arányban megfelel?.

Bewertung importiert von bier index:
