Copenhagen 16/10 2014. 50 cl can from Rema 1000. Pours dark brown almost black with light brown head which subsides quickly. Aroma is sweet malts and a little coffee. Low carbonation. Taste is rather neutral at first but opens up with notes of coffee , a little chocolate and nice bitterness for balance. Nice Dark lager.
Little bit sweet, nice caramell malt taste, nice thick foam lasting long time. Very nice, easy beer, much enjoyed by ladies too.
Bottle. 0,5L Price: ~0,85€. Neilgai išliekanti puta. Graži spalva. Geriamas, bet yra ir geresniu.

0,5 l bottle, apparently in a new design, named Budvar B: Dark Lager. 
Black, caramel-colour dense persistent froth. 

Aroma: malty, aromatic wood.
Palate: definetely a Pilsener, quite light and dry for a dark beer, I would have expected something more porter-style. I imagine a brewer having done Pilsener all his life and now brewing his first porter. This is what comes out. Very drinkable - I could surely manage to drink two bottles.

Po pewnym niesmaku wywołanym Budweiserem B:Strong, nie miałem specjalnych oczekiwań wobec ciemnego Budvara. Czarny kolor w szkle, z beżową pianką prezentował się jednak obiecująco. W zapachu również zawodu nie było - czekolada, nieco paloności nawet... Smak w sumie mnie zaskoczył. Nie zanotowałem większych wad, dodatkowo pojawiły się nuty kawowe. Do tego niskie wysycenie dodawało pijalności. Choć piwo jest nieco nudne, jest całkiem przyzwoite i łatwe w odbiorze...
Studená fľaša z chladničky. Krásna farba aj pena, príjemná karamelová vôňa. Chuť vyvážená, nie príliš sladká, v Budejoviciach vedia čo robia. Veľmi dobré čierne pivo!

Bottle during vacation in Austria.
Appearance: clear ruby brown with bubbly beige head.
Aroma: hops, vague rosted malt.
Taste: medium bitter-sweet.
Palate: refreshing, somewvhat watery, light body, medium carbonation.
Overall: ok

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours deep dark brown with big brownish head.
Aroma is sweet, roasted malts, caramel, light nut,yeast. Taste is light bitter with sweet notes, watery a bit, light nut , malty. Medium carbonation. Medium body. Nice summertime drink.
Malt heavy lager, that must be a pale imitation of the original budvar version.
Geruch schwach malzig und leicht metallisch. Geschmack leicht rauchig, süßlich. Ansonsten leicht wässrig.
Clear, mahogany color. Beige head moderate, dominant chocolate aroma. Soft carbonation. Watery. Refreshing and pleasant, but nothing special.
Bottle 0.5l. Clear dark liquid. Medium to light body. Taste of caramel. Not bad. Drinkable.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, roasted caramel, malty.
Appearance: clear deep black color, beige head.
Taste: medium bitterness (herbs), dark roasted malts, herbs, roasted caramel.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Quite enjoyable beer, pretty good dunkel.

330 ml bottle at the in-laws. A bit past the best before date. Dark brown with ruby tint, tan head. Aroma bready, thick, dark chocolate and roasted malt, taste is similar, roasted, light chocolate, darker malts and bread.

Can 0.5l from Delhaize Maxi store Belgrade Serbia.Taste wirh Vlada at Beerville Beer shop Belgrade Serbia.Pour it dark color with medium white head.Taste and aroma kicks with roasted malt, but immediately disappeared, watery to the end.Little bit disappointed.

Mildly smokey aroma. Dark red, nearly black. Looks like coke. Basically an ipa with a caramel syrupy taste to it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0.5 bottle imported. Pure black color, small foam. Aroma of roasted caramel, bitter taste, but good after taste of caramel.

Flaska på jägers - påminner lite om en Ale i aromen. Kolsvart med beigt skum. Lite tunn i kroppen. Lite chokladtoner O smaken.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Leicht süßlich im Antrunk mit angenehm malzigen Karamellaroma. Etwas bitterer, langer Abgang
Malziger Geruch, Touch von Diacetyl. Im Geschmack erstaunlich röstig für Mainstream, dann aber wässrig.

0,5 l bottle. Dark reddish brown (if held into the light) to black, clear liquid. Thick, creamy, slowly fading, tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee with hints of licorice. Not very intense though. Taste follows the aroma with a light sweetness. The finish is slightly bitter. Medium body, average carbonation. Pleasant beer that misses some intensity and excitement but goes down really well.
500ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a small beige head that fades instantly. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and a hint of smokiness. Slight bitterness in taste.
0.5l bottle. Totally black color, can’t see through it. Big coffee-like head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, nuts, little smoky. Finish is bitter with taste of coal, very interesting.

Nice dark brown, tan head. Aroma: burnt dark bread, caramel
Taste: Bitter chocolate, caramel malts, light body, light sweetness and medium bitterness.

Couleur noire, reflets ambrés, légère mousse beige. Nez leger malt grillé, notes un peu chocolat. Gout malt grillé, houblonné, notes douces caramel. Corps très léger. Fin houblonné amere et notes grillées. Pas trop mal.

Very dark amber with a dark off white head - Dark malt aroma with some carameln and hints of roasted malt - Rosted malt flavour with some hints of caramel and bitterness - Roasted malt finish that has some caramel - A little bit thin, but still nice
Bottle. Dark red-brown color with small & fast-disappearing beige head. Aroma of roasted malt and rye bread. Taste is light bitter. Some dry plums in aftertaste. Fairly good tmavy.

This is the first dark Czech beer I’ve tried; it is markedly different from any German dark beers I’ve had, more so than the Czech pilsners differ from German ones. Very dry, wit roast strongly evident in the aroma, but the roast has little "burnt" quality, it’s more toasty, which I like. Not as hoppy as I’d like, and I think much less hoppy than the standard Budvar. Very little sweetness. Moderate body. I strongly prefer the regular Budvar, because of its happiness and bitterness.  But this could be good for a change of pace, and I do prefer it to a number of other dark beers.
On tap at Bokovka. Pours dark brown color, lightly beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, some caramel. Taste is medium sweet, roasted malt, caramel.

Pours dark with medium frothy off white head
Aromas of dark malts, wee bit roasted
Taste has pilsner makts, roasted malts hints of dark fruits, wee bitt german sausage
Good dark lager
Slight malt and chocolate taste. Coffee and hoppy edge. Mildly sweet with a bitter finish. Good dark beer.
Malty, slightly nutty aroma. Black and opaque in color. Malt flavors are quick on the front and then overcome by the hops, which are quick and clean.

caramel, coffee, roasty, grass, basement aromas, leather, alcohol, smoke, black, clear, brown foam, minimal head, medium bitterness, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter,
Pours a dark brown, slightly tanned head. Aroma is malty, slightly raisins. Taste has roastiness. nice balance.

Hmm.. quite pleasant surprise. Decent light roasted malty background with mild but all the way pleasant choco presence, light coffee, caramel, feels well balanced with light fruitiness from hops. Moderate sweet with light bitterness. Drinkable and quite enjoyable
On tap at a bar in central Praha. Dark bordeaux color, almost black, big cappuccino head. Aroma: toasted malts, coffee icecream. Taste sweetish. Flat short finish, Light bodied.
Dark brown colour. Roasted malt, dry, some fruits, caramel, some herbs too.

Bottle from Beer Run, Czechvar Dark label, best buy 01.31.14, so several months out of date even though I got this a few days ago and it was also new at the retailer. Pours a dark brown color with a thin creamy tan head. Poor head retention. Skunky aroma with notes of raisin and caramel. The taste is raisin, coffee, caramel, skunky hops. Thin bodied. Could be refreshing if not shipped way out of date in a green bottle. Fail.
Dark brown with stable beige head. Aroma is roasted malt and caramel. Taste of chocolate, coffee, slightly bitter at the end.
Dark brown body with a light brown head. Aroma is caramel, roasted malt, toffee, some coffee. Taste is sweet with a medium bitterness. Roasted. Aftertaste not as good. Shame could be better.

Pours a cola color with a small tan head. The nose is fruit, brown sugar. The taste is roasty, a little slow, brown sugar, fruit ending dry. Light+in body with a touch less than average carbonation. The nose isn’t big but the flavor is.

a)  Schöne schwarz-rötliche Farbe, beiger Schaum. Der Geruch ist süßlich-trocken mit angenehmer Malznote. Im Antrunk ist das Bier vollmundig-süffig, ganz leicht säuerlich. Zum Hauptteil entwickelt sicht eine angenehme malzig-röstmalzige Schwarzbiernote, leichte Lakritztöne, verbranntes Brot. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang anhaltend, schön vollmundig-röstmalzig-trocken und dazu schön abgewogen herb mit ganz leichter Süße. 
→ Ein leckeres, böhmisches Schwarzbier! 


 
  b)   Thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing.  Smooth malty nose, nice malty roasty start. 
The mainpart is nice roasted, very dry, nice malty bitter. On the tongue remains a nice malty dry aroma with hints of liquorice and roasted malt.
Pours a black colour, taste is of roast malts and dry on the palate, quite a nice beer
Bottle 50 cl. Pours brown dark with white brownish head. Notes of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, nuts, caramel. Pretty nice dark lager. Goes down easy and has plentyful taste.
Bottle->lager glass. Deep amber brown with moderate lite beige head. A: toasted malt, bread, cocoa notes. T: roasted malt, nuts, notes of herbal hops. Mildly bittersweet with good carbonation. Ok.
draught. Ruby black with two finger white head. Very malty, lightly roasted, chocolate. Decent.
Aroma of slightly toasted malts, bread, light chocolate, brown sugar. Flavour is malty and sugary, medium sweetness. Overall, nothing special.
0,5l on Tap at Dvoracky. Dunkles Bier mit beiger Schaumkrone. Riecht angenehm nach Röstmalzen. Schmeckt nach Röstmalzen; nuancen von Nüssen und Kaffee. Süffig!
Weak roasted-malt aroma, strong carbonisation level. Nice hints of coffee and chocolate, malty, roasted, nice ballance and oily moutfeel afterwards. Decent brew.

330ml bottle from the duty free shop at Vaalimaa border station. Very dark brown colour, medium frothy, mostly lasting tan head, good lacing. Moderately malty roasty aroma of bread and nuts with notes of coffee and chocolate with light herbal hops and some hints of red berries. Taste is initially moderately sweet, slightly bitter and slightly acidic, turning into a longish moderately bitter finish with a burned feel. Light to medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation. A fairly tasty Tmavy, fair bit better than I remembered.
Bottle. Very good, stable, beige head. In aroma mostly fruits. In taste is also fruity with low bitterness. Medium carbonation.

Had this bottled so many times as it’s available even in pubs with poorest selection. Dark brown beer with a small head. Roasted malts in the aroma with some chocolate and hops. Flavour is roasted malts, hints of chocolate and some refreshing hops too. A basic Tmavý which I always drink with pleasure.
Bottle. Off white head. Mahogany body. Nose is wood, dark fruit, hops, nuts, chocolate, spice. Sweet with some sourness. Dry finish. Fizzy mouthfeel.

0.5 l bottle. Pours clear dark brown, with a beige head. Aroma is light roasted malt and brown sugar. Taste is malt, sugar, and some hops. Slightly bitter and chocolaty finish. Low carbonation, Good beer :)
Bottle. Dark brown, tan head. Dark and slightly sweet malty notes in aroma. Dark bread, notes of roasted malts and hints of sweetness in taste.

Aroma: light toasted notes. Appearance: clear black, medium beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: malty notes coming up, toasted malts, bread and light caramel. Overall: nice Dunkel, decent palate. Pint at U Medvidků, Prague.

330ml bottle. Clear, ruby red glowing, dark brown colour with average to huge, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white to beige head. Sweet-ish, grainy aroma, cautious hints of sweet dark malt, grassy hoppy overtones, a cautious spicy touch of lovage. Taste is dry dark malty, subtle dark malty sweetness, some malt-spiciness, grassy hoppy overtones, a touch of hay, some grain. Not to sweet, the otherwise typical malt lozenge sweetness is kept at bay by integrated hop notes with hints of grass and hay; sadly a grainy touch adulterates the result by evoking a brummagem effect.

Can, 50cl. Pours deep brown towards black with a foamy, creamy beige head. The roasted, slight burnt malty nose is everywhere. Syrupy, light ash, along with light milk chocolate, weak coffee, nuts and toffee. Creamy and inviting. Flavour is... where is it? Light sweet with the expected roasted malt character, black berries and dried fruits, caramel and chocolate/coffee notes, albeit very weak. Ends with bit dry and with a pleasant bitterness. Smooth, soft carbonated and drinkable, but too watery, thin bodied to fulfill its potential. Too bad - deserves better.

50cl can. As good as a bottle. Pours pitch black with porter-like head. Creamy, smooth, velvety and silky. Pleasant carbonation. Slightly sweet. Loads of charred malt, caramel and some coco hints. I prefer it served at 8degC. Usually, when shopping, I forget how good it is, and get some other dunkels. This is actually almost perfect.
50 cl bottle. Light brown pour. Nose has loads of roasted malts and some vanilla. Taste has again roasted malts, figs and vanilla.

dark brown colour with reddish notes and huge, dense, long lasting brown head; aroma of bread, some fruitiness, ash and hints of caramel/chocolate; taste of roasted sugar,, bread, some coffee and sourish notes; correct tmavy

Surprisongly outstanding beer. It’s very simple: water, malt, hops. Nothing specific like spices or mix of hops varieties. Just beer. And it’s very quality beer. Roasted malt is everywhere: from the nose to the aftertaste on your tongue. This beer is also suitable for refreshing during hot summer day.

The only thing i regret about this beer - haven’t tried with my best friend sinfull :(
Now he is ocean across from me so this mission seems to be impossible

0,5 can from Alkopörs?, Tallinn. Coca-cola colour with non-lasting xl-brown head. Some roasty, syrapy aroma. Bitterness. Some watery.

Pours dark brown with small tan head. Aroma of mild coffee, bit of nuts, some chocolate, but pretty light aroma. Taste is a bit sweetish. Dry aftertaste. It used to be better.

Sötétbarna színű teste fölé egy tömött habkorona fejlődik, melynek utóélete egy ujjnyi vastag réteg formájában viszonylag hosszúra is nyúlik. Aromája malátás, némileg zárkózott, idővel egyértelműbbé válik. Az első benyomásokat egy kissé vizes állagú, pörkölt malátás, kávés ízvilág adja egy komlós háttérízzel kiegészülve. Az enyhén édeskés benyomás egy stout jellegű zamatból adódik, melyhez némi tejszerű aroma párosul. Voltaképpen azok közé a sörök közé tartozik, amelyeknél a könnyebb elérhetőség nem feltétlenül jár együtt alacsonyabb minőséggel.

0,5L can, BB 01.08.14. Pours very dark ruby-black with tan head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is rather weak caramel, malt, and roast. Taste is sweet, roast, malt, smoke, tobacco, caramel and some faint metallic notes. Finish is smoke and some bitterness. Overall: body is a little bit too watery and aroma isn’t that great, but otherwise it is one of my favorite dark lagers.

On tap, budvarka, 36czk/0.5l. Black body with creamy brown head. Aroma has complex caramel, light roasty. Taste has light roasty bitterness with coffee caramel sweetness. Body is full, very high carbonation. Pretty good.
Bottle, pours brown with red tints and a beige head, tastes of roasted malt and caramel, light bitter finish, better than the pale version

Deep redbrown/black, clear, thin light brown head leaves foggy island on top, lacing is dense and long but not sticking to sides. Malty aroma has syrupy bread, light ash, milk chocolate, mild coffee, starts sweet but dries. Very dry malty flavor, light body, bit watery feel, low carbonation, long malty finish. Bit watery but ok.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

A really nice Tmavy. Much darker than the usual amber brown, this one is really dark brown almost black. Otherwise a nice example of the czech style. Nutty and malty and doesn’t send you three sheets after a few. Dry and short finish maybe the only down side.

0,5 l green glass bottle. Pours out black with a huge light tanned head. Roastmalty on the nose. Starts roastmalty, black berriefruits, coffie, caramell hints, dark chocolade, but even a little bit thin. But great one under the label Lager!
Bottle. Hazy, black, minimal head, brown foam, medium bitterness, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

Pours deep red with a big fizzy light brown head which lasts a good while. Aroma is lager malts, light roastiness, caramel, hints of dark fruit and berries and a bit of corn. Taste is slightly sweet and roasty followed by some malts and flowers. Nicely sweet with a light bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation.
Clear dark brown with frothy tan head. Aroma roasted malt and caramel. Slightly sweet to taste. Thick texture. Sustained carbonation.

Draught at Bohemka. Dark brown color with white off creamy head. Coffee aroma. Flavor of roasted malts, coffee. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Bottle 0.5 l. Brown color, medium head. In nose nutty, toast notes. In flavor again nuts, chocolate. Not bitter. Mostly in bourders of style. Overall: pretty good.

Musty, metallic aroma. Maybe a little oxidized. Deep black color with ruby highlights if held to the light. Taste is slightly flowery which might make this a little out of style for a Schwarzbier or Munich dunkel style. But nonetheless a pretty good beer in its own right.

Malt, sweet sugar, mild berries and

Smells sweetish roasted malt. Dark red beer with a fine head of foam. The Antrunk is roasted harsh. Aromas of dark chocolate and coffee, some caramel and dark dried fruit. Pleasantly round taste, not too carbonized. Better than expected
Can from Tesco, Hungary. Dark brown color, medium beige head. Strong aroma of raosted malt, coffee and caramel. Taste is medium-strong, earthy, dark, sweet and bitter enough. Not bad.
Dark pour, disappearing head, malty chocolate aroma. Taste is coffee, roast malts and burnt notes. Nice
Pours a dark brown. Aroma is light roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, some burnt toffee and finishes mildly bitter.
Large beige sandy head above purple brown. Roasty , dark chocolate nose and palate . A good honest industrial style Dunkle .

Bottle at Prague Airport. Poured a clear dark brown with a big frothy tan head. The aroma is roasted malt sere treacle toffee light yeast. The flavour is medium bitter with a watery caramel malt light bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Backlog. Tried on tap at Green Lion Inn. While the pilsners from the large Czech breweries often bore me the dark ones still hold their ground. This is a worthwhile try although it’s not quite as good as for example the Primator.
One of my personal favourites. Often in supermarket multi buy offers, well worth grabbing a few when it is!
Bottle. Pours brown, with a tan head. Aroma is light roasted malt and brown sugar. Flavor is malt, sugar, and some hops.Thin body, slightly bitter and chocolaty finish.

On tap. Roasted malt aroma. Dark brown with two finger beige head. Lighter taste. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Solid beer.
500ml bottle at home. Pours clear dark brown, thin off-white head. Light roast and dark sugar aromas. Caramel and toffee on the taste. Light bitterness. Clean finish. Not bad.
Bought a 24 box from duty free. No expectations. Nice Surprise. Very drinkable, such a Nice Taste! Roasted fruits. Quality Beer Taste in Standard product. 24 is definitely not too much.
Dark colored with medium tan head. Full body, creamy. Aroma is coffee, really strong one. Slightly bitter. Somehow watery. It was much better before.

Draught at U Medvidku, Prague, January 2014. Very dark brown with light beige head. A little roasty and caramel aroma, slightly bitter and a little dry taste. Full body, light carbonation, sweet - a little honey finish.
A very pleasant dark lager. Coffee and chocolate notes, smooth mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Full flavoured and yet refreshing. Very nice.
Bottle 500 ml, from supermarket. Pours dark ruby brown color. Roasted malt aroma and flavor.

50cl bottle.
Clear very dark read with medium bedge head. Aroma of roasted malt and some dark fruit. Medium body with almost no carbonation. Malty taste with burnt coffee and little fruity notes.

Bottle, gift from David. Ruby body with a thick beige head. Excellent lacing. Creamy, chocolatey aroma. Flavour of milk chocolate, Twiglets and vanilla. Medium body with a smooth, luscious texture. Soft carbonation. A lovely Dunkel.

Bottle, poured into tulip glass. Rich dark brown, little light brown head. Aroma is burnt, roast, seems all malty not much hop. Taste is similarly burnt. Palate watery. Not hugely impressed, but I seem to remember thinking it was ace when I had it on draft a couple of years ago...

Kjøpt på Meny. Mørk i fargen, lite skum. Aromaen er litt anonym, vag kaffe, malt, vag tørket frukt og mild humle. Smaken er malt, humle og en veldig vag smak av kaffe. Minner om en veldig tynn porter. Behagelig. Tynn konsistens.
Взял по акции за полцены. Ожидал того, что и получил. Обычный тёмный лагер. Скучно.
Dunkel, leicht rötlich. Sehr malzige Aromen, Kaffee. Geschmacklich ebenfalls stark malzbetont. Erdig. Im Abgang tritt Bitterkeit hervor.

Clean, malty and refreshing. A good chugger for those who are thirsty and like a rich flavor.

Well this is an interesting dark lager. It features an earthy aroma with maybe some sweet caramel notes. Taste is a little musty with roasted malt flavors and some sweet bitterness in the finish.

Bootle from Tesco. Chestnut colour with frothy tan head. Flavours of caramel, a touch of chocolate and some roasty notes before quite a sweet finish. This is nice and refreshing and goes down easily. A very nice dunkel.
Beautifully preseted beers. Wonderful head and lacing. Pallate was bland in comparison to overall presentation of beer.

Appearance: Clear dark ruby/brown with 2 finger thick ivory/tan head.
Aroma: Hint of chocolate, pepper, hay, roast malts, slightly smoky, toast, cold coffee and spicy.
Taste: Low/medium sweetness and bitterness, medium sourness.
Palate: Thick smooth texture, light body, prickly carbonation, astringent lingering malty, spicy, toasty and bitter cocoa like finish.
Comments: Lovely and glass lace.

Bottle at home. Pours a deep reddish brown colour with a medium, light brown head. Malty aroma with rye bread, dried fruit, leather, wood and some chocolate. The flavour has more roasted malt and coffee, and some dried fruit and cola. Has a smooth and soft mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A decent and easy-drinking dunkel.

Bottle on the train from Inverness to Hereford, thanks to Simon C for the pour, 21/10/13.
Very dark mahogony brown with a thin tan head that dissipates to pondlife.
Nose is dark malt, toffee, woody, nutty, earthy tones.
Taste comprises bready malts, dark toffee, brown bread, brown sugars.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry malty finish.
Decent dunkel.

Aroma of molasses and cocoa mulch. Transparent brown with big, quick fading head. Dirty, bittersweet chocolate flavor. Lighter body, very smooth and refreshing so far as dark lagers go. Good Czech session beer.

Bottle. Aroma is sweet syrupy caramel. Nothing more. Light light coffee. Clear dark ruby-brown colour. Taste is lightly soapy, otherwise quite balanced coffee with caramel. Simple though, and not very enjoyable. Average industrial beer.
Malty brown color, frothy tan head. Milk chocolate, molasses, malt aroma and taste with czech hops for bitterness. Thin, watery texture. Cool palate. Tastes like a really good brown ale.
Almost clear but very dark brown appearance, medium head. Roasted malts and medium hops aroma, medium sweetness, well rounded. Good Dunkel style.

Blindprovad. Brödig i doften. Härliga rostade toner. Lite vörtknäcke. Sedan står det mitt provanteckningarna "kan ju inte läsa vad jag själv skriver". Och så är det. Kan jag möjligen ha skrivit brödig två gånger?...
On tap at Criterion Leicester... Lively in the glass, slight dark taste, nice and smooth. Not a lot to it
Dark with a tall tan head. Aroma is slightly roasted, malty, earthy. Flavor is dark malt, light roasted malt, a bit of dark sugar, chocolate. Highly enjoyable.  (Draught at U Medvidku)

11.2oz bottle. Has some of the crispness of the original underneath the dark malts. Medium bodied, sweet and sugary with a biting lemony bitter balance. Not really as rich, as much depth as you might hope for in the style. Not bad though..middle of the road.

500 ml-es palack. Tükrös. Igen sötét vörös színű, szinte már fekete. Hamar összeomló és eltűnő szivacsos bézs hab, ami fel sem épül rendesen. Apró, szinte észre sem vehető buborékok. Pörköltmalátás illat, mely a melegedés során fáradtan avassá válik. Könnyed, enyhén vizes test, kellemes szénsavasság. Krémesen karamelles édeskés íz. Pörkölt utóíz határozott komlókeserűséggel és a már említett krémes jegyekkel. Összegezve elmondható, hogy ez egy jó ivású, nagy megfejtések nélküli, kisebb hibákkal rendelkező Dunkel típusú sör.
caramel, brown/golden, clear, off white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, light bitter finish.
Bottle. Very dark brown color. Very explosive head pours really big. Light lace. Malty, slightly sweet, slightly skunky taste. Caramel, slight skunk aroma
>Dåse: Brun klar øl med et fint skumhoved. Duft af sødlig malt og lagergær. Smagen er meget sødlig maltet, men har etlethumleid der gør den drikbar.

Budvar tmavy served in a small glass goblet at brewery in 2011 (from notes). 
Žatek hops and 3 types of Moravian barley: Munich, caramel and roasted.
A semi-dry malty flavor that is more bitter than sweet.
The aroma is typical of a Czech dark lager, but the flavor is less sweet, a tad more hoppy, and more complex. 
Aroma is similar to the nearby Eggenberg dark that also uses Moravian barley.
Very dark mahogony, nearly opaque, with a light tan head that reduces rather quickly (typical for style) to a lating ring that leaves 
Iittle lacing.
Medium body and enough carbonation to impart some crispness
O - an outstanding Czech dark lager, although probably at its best here at the brewery. (Trying the beer again many km from the brewery, I find the beer to be indistinguishable from that at the brewery).
On tap at U Mediviku in Prague .. quite nice. Aroma of caramal and chocolate .... taste was medium bodied with a nice cocoa taste and mouth feel. Quite a nice dunkel actually.

Dark brown & small head. Light to medium body. Nose of roasted malt , bread & coffee. Pretty dry flavour with lots of roast & some bitter hop notes. Also earthy & dusty notes, coffee. Pleasant hoppy finish. Quite nice overall.
Mørk brun, nesten svart farge med beige skum. Lukt av malt og kaffe. Smak av malt, kaffe og karamell. Supermarked.

ON TAP.

Head: beige, small, frothy to creamy, poor retention. Colour: dark brown.

Taste: dry, quite roasted, some caramel, light to moderate bitterness.

from bottle.

For what it is, it is ok, BUT its not something special.Nice roasted taste, with with the blandness of a lager.

Large lught brown head and an brown body. Sweet aroma of roasted malt and dark bread. Medium sweet and light bitter. Oily texture and soft carbonation.

Bottle from Pedmore Wines, Stourbridge. Dark brown. Malty coffee and syrup aroma.  Tastes nutty and wooden with a disappointingly short finish.  Nice in the glass; not so nice on the sofa or my top.  Oops.

butelka, cuemne, brunatna pianka, dużo pianki, która zostawia długo fajny osad na ściankach kufla; trochę podobne do guinessa, czuć mocno palony słód a na końcu gorycz, dobre ale nie mógłbym wypić więcej niż 1.
Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Malty,roasted and caramel aroma ; Dark brown color with bigger head ; Sweeter taste with light bitter finish ; Medium body ; Pleasant beer.
Nov 2012 - big head, the taste and mouthfeel of this is more like a porter.  Quite sweet.  Tastes a bit like guinness extra cold.

.5l bottle @ Helmi
Pours dark brown/dark reddish with low tan head. Aroma is dark malts, brown sugar and bread. Flavor is bread, dark malts, hint of coffee. Nice co2. I like.
0,5l bottle. Aroma is roasted malt and coffee, and taste is pretty much the same, with some caramel. It has medium bitterness. Good beer.
Mörkbrun i färgen med offwhite skum. Sött mörkt bröd i doften, karamell, gräs. Smakar rågbröd med choklad på. Lätt fruktig ton med bitter avslutning.

Tap. Clear dark brown with a thick frothy off white lacing head. Aroma is light roasted malt, sweet chocolate, dark grain, very faint fruity hop notes. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Medium sweet and light bitter finish with chocolate.
Pours black with nice but short lived off-white head. Aroma of burnt sugar. Tastes caramel, possibly bit of vegetable, bitter malt. Quite highly carbonated.

35,5 cl bottle from Centra Høvik. Pours clear dark brown with a two finger light brown head that leaves quite fast. Dark caramel aroma, light caramel taste with some weak coffe notes. Flat carbonation, no bitterness,  light sourness. ok for a 4,7%

Mörkt brun öl med ett ljusbrunt skum. Doftar kafferost med en maltig sötma. I smaken så tar malten över. De rostade tonerna är det som skiljer från en bra tjeckisk pilsner. Perfekt till maten, t.ex grillat kött.

Budweiser is not very well liked by many beer lovers. But, I must contest that this Budvar Ceske Dark Lager is AMAZING for a regular everyday drinking beer. Dark, delicious, and refreshing. Fantastic dark lager!!
On tap @ Pension 7, Harrachov. Pours hazy very dark brown with small tan head. Dark aroma of malt and roasted coffee. Ditto taste. Reminds me of Köstritzer Schwatzbier, but is a little mire nuanced.

#12
Das Budweiser Schwarzbier ist malzbetont, aromatisch nach Kaffee und Karamell und hat einen röstmalzigen Abgang, der die Süffigkeit enorm steigert. Nicht wie Köstritzer Sauerbier und auch nicht leichtfüßig wie Krusovice Süßstoffbier, nein, dieser Stoff geht ins Blut waschechter Biertrinker!

50 cl bottle.

Originally rated on 20090307.

Pours dark red color with a small head. Aroma of sugary malts and caramel. Flavor of caramel malts, brown sugar and some fruits.

A Czech Dunkel! Is it all it takes to make a Dunkel exciting? To send it across the border? Of course not. That would be insulting even to the Budweiser master brewers in České Budějovice (and almost as offensive as the flavour of the American copycat of their pale lager). These people know how to make good beer.

Aroma: roasty; Appearance: black translucent, small tanned head; Taste: light-to-medium sweetness, slightly bitter; Palate: medium body, rather thin feel, average carbonation; short dry finish;
Overall: quite good dark beer

0.5L bottle. Usual caramel hop aroma, very delicate smoke shines. Taste is sour smoked and cooked vegetables with little caramel. Finish is stupid bitter herbs water. Waterly finish spoils it all. Nothing special.

330ml bottle. Roasty, coffe and caramel aromas, Pours very dark, with nice tan head, some persistance but almost no lacing. Light bodied, average to soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is malty, sweet, caramel, with strong roasted malt notes, very present at the end of the first sips, and continuing during the aftertaste. Balanced and nice. Enjoyable.

(500ml bottle from Waitrose) A dark reddish brown pour with frothy diminishing tan head and very light to no lacing. Light in body/carbonation. Aroma/taste is sweet roasted smokey caramel malt, with hints of mocca/chocolate. Kind of average overall.
33cl bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon. Dark brown color. Brown medium head. Low to medium carbonation. Light coffee aroma.

24.11.2012. 0,33l Bottle. Meny Karmsundgata, Haugesund. Dark brown colour with off-white head. Mslty aroma with lots of sweetness. Dark malts. Nice bitter aftertaste. Bitter at the end. Body is medium to thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle from Herkku Stockmann, Helsinki!


Pours deep brown and ruby red with a small head. Smells malty roasty with lots of caramel and chocolate. Starts bitter malty roasty, with lots of coffee and burnt malts. Middle part is also malty bitter and roasty, paired with some dark chocolate. Goes into a chocolatey finish with some burnt malts and roasted coffee.

Nice roast bitterness in this czech beer. Pours black witth sticky head. Aroma  of sweet coffee, taste is  dark chocolate with lingering bitterness on the palate. Not too bad. Sahem American Bud highjacked the name...

0.33l bottle. Ruby, dark brown body, light brown head. Dark fruity, caramely, coffee-like aroma with some breadyness. Taste is like the aroma, lots of caramel and dark fruits in it with some roastyness and toastyness. Drinkabilty is very good. Decent beer.

Aroma of coffee and peat. Pours small white head. Colour is mud brown. Taste is very malty, with some dark fruits in there such as figs and dates. Lingering fruity aftertaste. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer is black with a good tan head. The smell is of dark chocolate and brown loaves. The smatch is full of sweetness with a hint of hops afterwards. The body is light, but slick in the mouth. The finish is long and is where the hint of bitterness comes out. This is my first Dunkel/Dark Lager and I have to say that it is a lot better than I thought it would be.
Surprisingly nice , malts and chocolate, Fizzy and easy drinking a nice but light dark larger

Draught.
Pours a dark brown, with a beige head.
Roasted aroma, chocolate, malt, coffee, ashes, hops.
Dry, medium to full bodied, medium bitterness, creamy CO2.
Malty, roasted taste, caramel, coffee, licorice, ashes. (2012-09-10)
Tap at Lord Cliffen; dark black, sweet chocolate aroma, tastes of malty chocolate with slight hint of coffee quite good.

Bottle from Tesco. Dark brown beer with small head. Aroma of roasted malt. Taste is of roasted coffee and chocolate notes. The palate is a little disapointing rather watery. An OK beer will try other dunkels to compare.
Black colour, brown head. Roasted malt aroma, some caramel flavour, a bit thin

Mørk skum lidt 
Malt choklade kaffe nødder
Bitter lidt sød modrat. 
blød
@ u mekiov

Large tan head over dark body with ruby highlights. Aroma of roast, dark chocolate, and coffee. Quite pleasing.  Taste of roast and nuts, light body. More roast and some espresso in the palate. On the whole this is a bit of a one-dimensional beer (big roast and little anything else) but it does that one dimension well.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Nice dark beer comes a bit watery but full of aromas. Good one for a dark.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Pours in like a Schwarzbier with steady head. Aromas of roasted nuts and wood. Nice beer.

Wirstrom’s, Stockholm tap: Pours black with a brownish head... looks more like a Schwarz. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, and nuts. The beer has some lactose characteristics in my opinion, or maybe that is just the body when on tap. Nice mouthfeel as a result. Very slight roasted malt taste. This ain’t bad, and it does grow on you after a bit.

From beginning seems like a one trick pony on the roasty malt with subtle caramel.  This dominates and stands out to the end of the 500ml glass. The beer stands up thu-out.  I don’t get the coffee and chocolate complexities of other Czech darks at all.  This has something that staropramen dark is missing and vice versa....   maybe I’ll mix a half and half haha. Least the Staro gives off a deeper coffee aroma. 

2 Finger head dies rater quickly on the few I had in hot weather.  << update. 

I’m trying to understand the hop character. something tells me the roasty malts (that are sweet when I lick the inside of my cheaks and lips) are hiding the ingredients and process that are lost from the more original recipes.  Well my rating stands at a 2.8 ...  and could swing up to a 3 me thinks (maybe). Without this roast would be very flat. 

update: Get more of a bitter edge on this long finish note, almost stout and not multi-complicated a beer. Now have a better taste on this as the first time my throat was a bit off which the malt roast was a bit irratating. I now have a bit better bite on the top of the tongue so that also bumps up this beer for me a bit.  3 is kind :)

0.5L bottle.  Poured black with perfect 2-finger head.  Appetizing aroma, sweet. Taste is very pleasant and typical of the stye, a bit "oily" of a mouthfeel but not bad.  I like malty brews, and this one suits me fine.

Tap in Prague. Deep brown, clear appearance wit ha creamy light brown head. Raisin, plum, roasty dark malty, lightly nutty aroma. Thin, anise, charred, roasty malty flavor with a light chocolate note. Bleh.
Bottle at bar. Black color, beige head. Smooth, malty taste with some roastiness, a bit of chocolate and malts. Very nice dark lager.
Bottle. Roasty aroma with some coffee, malt and hops. Taste very similar, with something added, perhaps licorice, perhaps some spices. One of the better dunkels I’ve had.
Thin white head on dark body. Light roast aromas of chocolate, caramel, toffee. Pleasant taste, refreshing and light with burnt malts and coffee giving it some character.
First time drinking the real Budweiser, it’s really the best right now. Caramel, dark.
pours dark brown with a thin tan head.nice roasted chocolate aromas lead into some great roasted coffee, chocolate and toffee flavours. quite a pleasant dark beer.
Hazy brown color, thick beige head. Aroma of chocolate covered caramel. Taste is roasted coffee and chocolate.
Tap. Slightly reddish very dark brown color. Frothy light brown head. For a Czech lager there’s quite much of fruity hops in the aroma. Dry coffee flavor with some bitterness.
Bottle. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is hops, coffee and toffee. Flavour is caramel, ash with a bitter coffee finish.

500ml bottle. Deep brown color with thick burned head. Aroma is toasted bread and malts, some brown sugar sweetness and fruit. I can feel some of bitter chocolade.
It’s very smooth with sharp finish. Medium body and drinkable.
Very solid dark lager.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black colour with small light brown head, that goes into lace quickly. Aroma of chocolate, cookies, caramel, dark fruits. Taste is light sweet with honey notes and it turns into moderate bitter aftertaste.

500ml bottle. Deep mahogany body with a big mocha head, small bubbles and good retention, but not much lacing. Aroma is hoppy, some burned caramel, coffee and vanilla.
Flavour of lots of coffee, malt bitterness and yes, hops. No sweetness and low carbonation. Good, but was expecting more.

Brown 500ml bottle, best before Jan 2008, serve cold. Drank March 2007, served cold. 

Poured three times into my Budweiser Budvar tulip style tasting glass, which only holds 0.2 litres. Very dark maroon in colour with a full biege head. Held up to the light, it is sparkling and clear. 

Caramel and roasted, almost burnt malts fill the nose fairly well, boiled mushrooms too. 

The burnt malts from the aroma are to be found in the taste too, with the caramel also adding to the taste. 

Watery and fairly weak in the mouth, no great aftertaste. 

This is an OK beer, not one I will rush out and find again, but drinkable.

Farblich ist es sehr dunkelbraun, die Schaumkrone hält leider nur mittelmäßig, Es riecht intensiv lakritzig-süß und kaffeeartig und schmeckt schön röstig und etwas kaffeeartig, dabei ist es sehr süffig. Sehr leckeres Bier das einem Stout ähnelt und für den Alltag geeignet ist. Das werde ich mir in Zukunft häufiger holen. Wieder eine schöne Kreation von Budweiser! 
   
Test vom 10.6.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche  Noten: 12,13,14,13,14,14 - 13,50
0,5l bottle. Dark brown, almost black color. Medium beige head, disappears quickly.  Roasted malts, smoke, caramel in aroma. Dry, bitter smoky taste. Dry smoky ending, lasts.
Deep dark brown colour wih medium beige head. Aroma is roasted. Flavour is roasted, caramel, sweet, bitter aftertaste.
Bottle in Budapest restaurant. Black cola with light tan head. Sweet, roast malt nose. Dry, sweet malt body, plenty of flavor in a relatively mild package. medium carb. pretty tasty.
Much better than expected, nice body and strength. Plenty of caramel, burnt sugar and a little bitterness. Good brew.

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours clear brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

0,5l bottle from random supermarket, Budapest. Beautiful, clear, dark reddish brown color with huge, creamy, light brown. Good aroma with mild coffee, roasted malt, toast, some spicy hops and some smoke. Medium bitter-sour taste. Light body with creamy texture and average carbonation. Long roasted malt and spicy hop finish. Very delicious dunkel, well hopped, made from delicious malt. Very good in its style.
Clear very dark brown with a big off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and caramel. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 250312
Slightly sweet dark lager. Not remarkable by any means, but much better than the run-of-the-mill products find everywhere in the world. Good with Chech food.
Barva: tmavě hnědočerná, pěna hnědá. Vůně: karam: elová s lehkou kávovou stopou. Chuť: plné pivo, hořké se sladovým dozvukem na patře, lehce karamelová chuť.

Bottle @ Cardinal, Stavanger. Deep brown in color with a nice tan head. Aromas full of caramel, toastiness, faint vanilla and some chocolate. Flavors of caramell and some chocolate and coffee. Nice bitterness. Nice level of diacetyl. Medium in body. Great aftertaste.

0.33l bottle. This one pours a deep deep ruby-brown body with a nice big almost fluffy ashy head that sticks around. The aroma has lots of cohocolaty tones blended with dark malts and cold coffee. Average carbonated and it’s quite medium-bodied. Ashy almost smoky actually - flavors with tones of thin chocolate paper, cold coffee and dark malts. Quite delicious and quite good actually. Paired with apple cake and ice cream! Will definitely buy again. 03.03.2012
leather, floral, chocolate, butterscotch, licorice, smoke, brown, sparkling, brown foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,
bottle  pours very dark brown with creamy tan head . aroma of malts and  burnt wood  . not too sweet  taste light maltiness  and a slightly bitter finish . It’s just a bit watery and bland really

pours dark brown with off white head. aroma is rich with caramel, chocolate, and roasted malts. found the taste a bit disappointing, some chocolate sweetness, coffee bitterness, but all a bit one dimensional. its ok, but prefer its blonde cousin.
Had this beer some time ago, transferring data from  database before Januar I was using to rate beer. As I drink this again I will add a complete review.

Deep brown topped by a light creamy head. The nose is rich and toasty with a caramel, vanilla and chocolate notes including roasted malt aroma. It gives a bitter taste with spicy and herbal flavour. Body is medium, carbon high. Coffee and chocolate with dark fruits palate. Bitter aftertaste. B@H
Roasty yet lagery. Warming up there is a great dark crystal malt aroma and taste. Bar a little metallic twang to begin with, this turns into a fine pint.

Bottle from Meny, Ringnes park. Pours dark brown with a small off-white head.
Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and chocolate. Pretty sweet taste with a dry and slightly bitter finish.

Bottle at home. Dark brown pour, thin off-white head. Aroma is roasty, some faint red fruits, bread, Czech hops and rye. Flavor is slightly bitter, somewhat sweet and nice full bodied roasted malts. Decent brew.
Nice black beer which is not overdone.  Light bodied and a good summer quaffer.  Low head and low carbonation.

50cl brown bottle labeled in German from Vienna grocery store. Pours a clear dark mahogany with fading white head. Big "chocolate" aroma. Medium body, noticeable carbonation. Slightly dry dark malts flavor balance. No molasass or too much caramel dominant flavor common to most Czech dark beers. Light hop bitterness up front combines with carbonation to mitigate overly sweet flavor balance.  Otherwise clean lager. OKAY.

Bottled from waitrose. Really really dark with a delicate tan head. Sweet caramel, molasses and malt aroma. Flavours malty chocolatey, ever so slightly astringent. Lasting smokiness on the aftertaste. Not generally a lager fan though I like the genuine Budvars and this in particular. Really good and one of the few ’dunkels’ on sale around these here parts.

Bottle (500ml):

Some dark malts and hint of coffee to kick things off with followed by some grain around the middle of the drink. It smells quite rich with a little bit of sweetness plus there is a sort of nutty aroma at the end.


Dark mahogany brown with a large, tanned brown head. It’s foamy with good retention.


Some nice dark malts to begin with that aren’t too strong and seem to be well balanced with the vanilla and chocolate flavours that follow it. There is a subtle sweetness to the beer and it is rounded off with a hint of coffee and more mild malts.


Smooth and medium bodied with a nice amount of carbonation, the beer has a nice feel to it & is easy to drink. It is pretty well balanced too.


Well balanced, iIt had a nice look and feel to it & again is a beer I would go back to if I could find it more easily.



One of the 1001 Beers To Try Before You Die @
Pours dark/brown with a small head. Aroma brown sugary, nuts and roasted malts. A somewhat typical sweet Czech beer, but Not Bad.

Bottle @ Bjarne. Pours dark brown with a offwhite head. Aroma of light roasted malt, light dark chocolate and licorice. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, licorice. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation. 131111

500 ml. bottle from the supermarket. Nearly black colour with dark brown hues. Small, creamy tanned head that fades quickly. From the aroma I get bitter chocolate, coffee and some caramel notes. Medium sweetness with notes of roasted grain, medium, creamy palate with a lively carbonation. Nice, roasted bitterness in the finish. Short finish. I like this no-nonsence Czech dunkel. Dirt cheap as well.
Bottle in Prague. Brown with a tan head. Rich caramel aroma. Rich sweet dark malt flavour. Caramel, roasted malt and some vanilla

Cool, I didn’t even know that there was a dark Budweiser Budvar! And dark it is: dark Coke brown with a red tint. The long-lived, large head is light brown, and laces the glass very well. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma, I get chocolate, coffee and roasted notes. The taste isn’t as sweet as the aroma led me to believe, and there is a nice light bitterness in the rather short finish, The flavours are chocolate and coffee and also smoke. Light to medium body, watery to oily texture and medium carbonation. A nice dunkel! 

[33 cl bottle, from Ultra Bryn, Oslo]
From bottle. Pours black with tan head. Toasty malt aroma. Roast malt flavor up front, coffee, chocolate, followed by metallic lingering note. Not bad
Bottle - pours black with a thick tan head.  malt, molasses and a hint of caramel. light roast malt flavour some hop on the dry finish.
Pours nearly black with a clingy tan head. Aroma is roasted malt and bittersweet chocolate. Dry, bitter finish.

Bottle 33cl. Black beer, with beige, creamy and persistent head. Aroma is malted, chocolate, roasted, smoke. Coffee taste and roasted; medium bittery, full body and average carbonation. Finish lightly bitter with roasted hints.
Bottle.looks great. Black with tan head. Impotent coffee nose. Taste is marginal coffee, caramel with a nice mouthfeel. A fine beer that could do with more body. It’s no Dark Kruso.
Mostly sweet, with some bitterness, tastes of coffee in the finish. Aroma of malts. Dark brown colour, tan head. (33 cl bottle)
caramel, roasty, hay, chocolate, earthy, dough, brown, clear, coffee, medium bitterness, light sweetness, light body, creamy, soft carbonation,

Bottle. Pours black with a small creamy tan coloured head. Aromas of bitter chocolate, espresso and dark caramel. Quite sweet with some roasted grain in te back ground. Flavours are quite sweet withnsome roasted grain bitterness on the finish. Medium creamy mouthfeel. Liked it.

330 ml bottle from Wasanas in Germany. Dark brown with red hints to it and a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt with some caramel. Taste is of coffee, milk chocolate and caramel with a bitter palate. Not bad at all.

From a 500ml bottle on 2/8/2011. Pours an extremely dark amber with big creamy head. Has a pleasant malty aroma, with a touch of chocolate. There’s quite a bit going on flavour wise - a big dollop of roasted malt, chocolate, a bit of coffee, some smokiness and a firm bitterness. A very enjoyable dark beer.

50 cL bottle, Scandic Hotel, Kuopio. Pours dark brown with a small creamy tanned head leaving lace. Aroma is very nice; roasted malts, fruity, sweetish and hoppy. Lean velvety medium body mouthfeel. Flavour is malty, roasted,  chocolate, fruity, bitter and slightly sweet. Finishes not too bitter with a nice roasted touch.

Good dark colour. Aroma has some light roast but also spicy hop and a slight caramel, burnt caramel note. The mouthfeel is medium, more full than the regular pilsner as you would expect. There is a good malt flavour with a light roast edge that makes it interesting. Overall I quite enjoyed this beer and great euro dark lager.

500ml bottle. Very deep but level layer of light brown foam sits above a dark black base. Aromas are pleasant but not overly intense or overpowering. Flavour lets it down a bit, too thin and watery and light on the palate.
On Tap. It is a smooth textured, tasty dunkel. It really hit the spot on a hot summer’s day.

500ml bottle from Dan Murphy’s. Dark brown pour with a medium beige head. Nose is toasted malts with caramel and coffee notes. Flavour is sweet malts with a slight bitter finish. Easily drinkable with a low carbonation and a light-medium body. A bit too sweet for my liking.

Pours dark brown, almost black, with a large lasting head.
Nose shows lots of rich dark malt with nutty notes, chocolate, cola and spicy hops.
Similar flavours, lots of nutty and bready malt with cocoa underneath. A bit cloying. Finishes with a mild roasty bitterness.
Carbonation is a bit full on, body feels a bit watery.
Fra tapp på John Bull i Aalborg.  Ølet ser innbydende ut, og smaker ikke ille!  Det er et tydelig brent-preg, men lite maltsødme igjen.  Relativt kort.  En behagelig øl uten de helt store noen veier.

Sehr würziger Geruch mit deutlichem Karamalmalz Ton. Leichtsüßer Antrunk, der direkt von einem leicht bitteren Aroma verdrängt wird. Auch beim malzigen Teil des Bieres ist eine übergeordnete Bitterkeit vorhanden. Schom im Mittelteil kommt eine Hopfigkeit dazu, die aber nicht besonders stark erscheint, genau wie das ganze Bier. Das soll nicht heißen, es wäre ein wirklich mildes Bier, aber wirklich kräftig ist es nicht. Süffiges Bier mit ansprechender röstmalzigen Note. 	 
Test vom 30.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,12,13,13,12,13 - 12,70

50cl bottle. Pours opaque black with a good head, most of which disappears quickly. The nose has chocolate and some smokiness. The taste has lots of chocolate and maybe some grapes. The palate has a rich texture, quite a big structure and it is quite clean. Overall, a very rich but balanced beer. Why do they have to put ’budweiser’ on the bottle? It doesn’t make sense.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, with a creamy head quickly receding head. The aroma is very pleasant but not overpowering, with sweet caramel malt, light notes of smoke and a very light hint of the saaz hops in use. Flavour is of sweet, lightly roasted malts and some smoke that sticks in the finish.

Light tan head, fades quickly, over a dark mahogany beer. Smells predominantly of the malts, toastiness with chocolate and caramel  but there is also some spice there from the hops. Medium body with up front flavours from the hops dominating with the sweeter malt flavour showing up later. Nice easy drinking beer, I’d buy it again.

Bottle. Dark brown, big tanned head. Smells of smoke, chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is smokey with hints of tar. Medium malty. Small amounts of sweetness. Good dry feel. Finish is well bitter with hops.
Nice balance, some sweetness and a strong hint of liquorice. Goes down easily, not overly complex but certainly a good beer.
Bottle 500ml. Great, well balanced dunkel. Aromas of chocolate, caramel, and coffee. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness. Palate is oily, with a thin-to-medium body. Dark brown with a frothy head.

Bottle. Dark brown color,almost black. Nice, creamy head. Slightly metallic aroma at first which turns into a slightly chocolate/licorice kind of malty aroma. Good mouthfeel, very drinkable. Fruity flavor, with some chocolaty malts, some roasty notes and a hint of metallicness. Not bad.

Dem super-dunklen Dark Lager entsrömt ein schwer malzig-röstiger Geruch, stout-artig. 
Der Geschmack ist kaffeeartig-karamellig, wobei sich die Herbe dezent im Hintergrund hält. 
Ein trockenes Finish bildet den Abschluß. 
Das Dark Lager von Budweiser Budvar bedarf einer gewissen Eingewöhnung, die sich aber lohnt. Ein ausgewogenes, leckeres Bier, das durch seinen sahnigen Körper zu gefallen weiß. 
In der Bewertung ein glatter Durchmarsch der 12.Test vom 13.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

500ml bottle, from CBA, Hungary. Fine sweet, chocolate and caramell smell, but taste isn’t harmonic, isn’t sweet at all. It is not problem, but not harmonic. Medium tasted, dark brown beer with correct foam and Co2. Sometimes earthy Saaz hop is too strong for this beer, especially at first, and aftertaste.

Neat good sized biege head mahogany coloured pour soft carbonation aroma nutty rich chocolate a real toasted burnt aroma flavour rich chocolate good bitter low medium ibu slight grittyness nutty caramel smooth good sweetness finish good hop aftertaste dark flavours sweet malts lasting bitter likeable dark lager
Well, pleasantly surprised. It was pretty drinkable. Bottle from my local offy. Poured dark with a medium light brown head. Aroma of a pleasant old man. Hint of Werthers Original, smoke and coffee.

Wonderful chocolate toffee on the nose. Immediately thinnish on the palate, there is a moderate chocolate and cream fining running from first contact to a medium finish. Easy drining and more to it than most in the style.

Áttetsző sötétbarna hozzá a természetesen világosbarna hab. Illata édes malátás. (Ízre nem édes.)
Megkóstolva meglepően vékony sör kerül a nyelvünkre barna létére. De nem gond mert kellemes harmonikus, kávés, pörkölt, hamus. Karakteres maláta komponens. 
Komlós keserű, lágy rövid utóízzel. Mindent egybevetve jó sör.
Bottle @ The Crystal Palace JDW & a present. Grassy flowery malt aroma. Very dark brown colour with a good beige head. Caramel coffee malt flavour. Watery texture. Average.

33cl bottle from a local supermarket. It pours an almost pitch black liquid with some amber-ruby reflections, and with a medium beige head that dissipates and leaves no lacing. The aroma is very nice, mostly malty, with chocolate notes and a brandy like smell. It tastes likewise, sweet, with a light and pleasant hoppiness that partners with a coffee-like aftertaste, ending dry. Carbonation is soft, as it is the bitterness. While it is small-medium bodied and might have a little watery hint, It leaves a pleasant parfum in your mouth. Relaxing and refreshing dunkel with a very nice presentation (but no personalized crown cap).

U medvídků, Prága. Nagyon-nagyon sötétbarna színű, tetején pedig kitartóan megül a piszkosfehér, enyhén krémes hab. Illata nagyon üde, édeskés a pörkölt malátától, karamelltől és medvecukortól. Íze egy fokkal gyengébb, néha kicsit bántóan cukrosan édes, de azért nem rossz és frissítően hat, ami nem mindig tulajdonsága a dunkeleknek. Közepesen testes, frissítően szénsavas, száraz, kellemes főzet, de semmi különös.

Draft @ Green Lion Inn, Malmö.  Pours a dark ruby brown color with a small longlasting off-white head. Had a slightly roasted sweetish malty  caramel aroma. Roasted malty sweetish bready caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty caramel finish.

Dark ruby-brown. Small off-white creamy head that dies down quickly but leaves a thin layer of bubbles on top. Plenty of lacing left behind, but in sheets. Big malt and hop aroma. Much like the regular pils they offer with a bit of roastiness mixed in. Dry and sweet with a hop bitterness left over. Quite a good dark lager.

330 ml bottle. Dark brown and clear. Small off-white fine-laced head. Soft nutty malt aroma. Hints of chocolade and brownies. Roasted malt flavours with a light smoky note. Caramel and a little ash. Velvety texture, but crisp and with a nice refreshing hop bitterness. Very drinkable.

500ml bottle as Budejovicky Budvar Imported Dark Lager. Pours a deep, dark chestnut, with a large beige head, passable retention and good lacing. An alluring herbal, forest aroma greets the nose, with some dark malt notes coming through. Spicy herbal hops start it off, with a smooth, tannin-dominant middle section and a lasting caramel finish. A nice example of quality dark lager. Good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a large, thick, beige head. Aroma is weak, some roasted malts and some soapiness. Flavor is fortunately nothing like that. Roasted malts, coffee, salty liquorice - quite a lot of it. Palate is medium and carbonated. Really made me want to have it with some good food. Maybe a hot tomato-sauce based stew?
bottle@home: yep, the other Budweiser, dark brown with white head, medium sweet, malt, raisins, burned toast & caramel, somewhat average but satisfactory
500ml bottle.  Pours dark brown with a medium head.  Aroma is milk chocolate and watery coffee.  Taste is coffee to start and a medium bitter coffee finish.

50 cl bottle, The Dram Shop, Sheffield, UK. Opaque coffee appearance, chocolate aroma with a hint of caramel and metal. Thick, coffee and more chocolate come through, with a bright hoppiness on the finish.
Bottled. Drinkable dunkel, maybe little too watery but in acceptable measure, still I like Krušovice and Kozel and Herold black beers more so this one is rather under average.

On tap at U Medvidku, Prague. Colour is jet black with a foamy tan head.  The nose is caramel and vinegar. Taste is caramel, coffee, dark chocolate and some vinegar. It’s uncomplicated but quite drinkable.

A pretty good dunkel, and a great example of a not-too sweet Czech version. A slightly watery palate. Frothy head, conditioning is fine. Medium brown with ruby. Moderate caramel/brown sugar in the flavor, very slight leafy vegetableness. Aroma is pretty good, with a little fall smoky leaf added to bready brown sugar goodness. Easy, easy to drink. Fresh example from Wine of Dreams.BB mid-May 2011.
Draught @ U Medvidku, Prague. Pours dark brown with a small white head. Sweet nose of fruit, bread and caramel. Tasty flavor of bread and caramel. Medium bodied. Clean.

Pours dark brown wih a medium tan head. Aromas of earthy pine, roasted malts and raisins. Taste is much the same, lots of earthy, roated flavours that make way for an easy drinking brew. Overrall its nice enough, just nothing special
Bottle. Dark brown color with medium white head. Aroma, cartamel, roasted malt. Taste starts sweet, caramel and hints of chocolate. Finis is nice bittersweet. Not bad.

500 mL bottle from Tesco poured into a pint glass at home.  Certainly looks like a dark lager.  Looks great with its dark as night colour and generous head.  Pleasant, rich but understated aroma, more like a porter than a lager.  It tastes like it smells, a very nice and smooth brew.  That said after a couple of glugs the novelty wears off a little. Still nice, but not excelling.

330 ml. bottle. Pours a dark mahogany colour, with a big tanned head leaving a lace all over when it fades. Smell is roasted, like burnt wood, earthy chocolate. Mouth has dried fruits, chocolate and a the burnt wood earthy  finish. Medium to light body, I would have like it a little bit more strong. Drinkable and good, but I prefer the usual lager one.
Bottle in La Palma (supermarket). Brown to black, stable foamy creme head. Aroma has malts. Full bodied taste and maly. Bitter finish, nice with very good lacing.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Clear mahogany with a finger thick, creamy brown head. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, roasted grains and light syrup. Roasted sweet, bitter and acidic. Short finish, light to medium body. Dry, medium carbonation

Very excited beer, couldn’t wait for me to tilt the bottle once the cap came off it leapt out the neck and straight onto the table beneath. What I did manage to get into the glass was awe inspiring visually. In a Budvar mug it presents the deepest, shimmering ruby tinged brown with very lively, fine carbonation raising up a mammoth, rocky, tannish head of foam that is enviable. Well retained, a mess of suds web the glass as it empties. Grassy, chaff whiff up first before revealing burnt, bitter caramel, tar and molasses on the nose. Sweet, fudge-like start runs head on into some smoky, burnt wood and forest-floor mulch. Big weedy hops give it a rough  taste of the beers of old. It’s so dry in the finish, with a pleasing smoky woodiness that draws out of the saliva glands. Hints of damp peat late, and some burnt dark fruit gives it a nice bitterness while a little pine resin and oak float through the mouth and throat. Soft, spritzy and creamy mouthfeel, medium to medium-light bodied. It’s good to see such rawness in a dark lager, this is a uniquely flavoured Dunkel with all the traits of a good Kellerbier. Surprisingly nice. (50cL, BB 18/05/11, Cellarbrations Kinross)

330 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 4.7%. Dark brown colour, big to moderate tan head. Nice aroma of slightly burnt caramel and brown bread. The flavour has also notes of caramel, fresh black bread, and burnt brown bread toast. Not very sweet. Maybe not so exceptional, but a drinkable and decent dunkel. Should not be drunk too cold.
Secondo me in bottiglia perde molto (come la sua versione chiara) però era tutto sommato potabile

29th November 2006 
 Warning! Early amateur rating! Dark lager, at first the toasted malt was a bit overpowering but there is bitter chocolate and the crispness of the palate helps. A grower and ultimately quite drinkable.
Dark mahogany with a tan head. Earthy, malty nose. Toasted malts, some caramel, hint of sweetness and a hoppy, spicy and dry finish. It’s good and balanced, but I still prefer the lager.
Bottle - Clear - Dark redish color. Light tan head. Medium carbonation. Sweet. Caramel. Some roastiness. Earthy. Medium bitter finish.
great for desserts and a cold single one. a bit sweet but with a great bitternes and the most wonderful foam.

Big ol’ pint. Dark brown lager. Brown, almost grey tones in the head that is rather massive for some reason. A little roasted. Hay. Just a little bit sweet. It’s not exactly full-bodied but it’s not the thinnest kind either. Just a little bit of something sweet. like syrup, on the nose. Towards the end of the pint I begin to notice some chocolaty notes.

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 24.4.2009.

Pours a dark brown colour with a small beige head. Toasted malts on the nose. Mild sweet aroma of toasted malts, caramel with mild coffee notes. Medium bodied with a surprisingly watery mouthfeel. Decent Dunkel.

Bottle. Dark brown with some red at the edges, large loose beige head. Rather fresh aroma of caramel and earthy/ grassy hops. Taste is barely sweet with chocolate and caramel. A touch of bitterness at the end with a little explosion of spiciness as well as some earth. Less sweet and much hoppier than others listed here as Dunkels I’ve had. I’ve never got the fuss about their pilsener, but this is an elegant quaffer indeed.

02/09/2010 - 50cl bottle @ bar in Koprivnica 


Clear darkbrow beer with deep red glare. Little beige rocky head. Aroma has caramel, dried fruits and some dark chocolate.  Medium body and somewhat creamy texture. Taste of caramel, brown sugar and mocha. Aftertaste has coffee and toffee. Correct brew, but not very interesting.
Had at several bars in Prague. Lovely dark lager. Coffee flavors. Mineral and rich, but very very drinkable. A favorite of the missus. Serving: Tap

No aroma at all. this isn’t so good. Quite roasty, but with a strong nutty character as well as tasting a bit buttery. Finish is thin. Very disappointed with this. It may have some coffee notes as well. On tap at a bar in Prague.

Bottle. Pours a clear brown with a creamy tan head that lasts ages. Aroma is very malty with notes of caramel and bread. Flavour is similar but a bit more roasted and has some dark fruit undertones. Quite dry mouthfeel with moderate carbonation and a mildly bitter finish. Nice and sessionable.

Bought in the supermarket. 
Pours dark brown with thin head. Smells like brown bread, raisins and caramel. Light body, a bit watery. Balanced in taste, its bitterness was a nice surprise.

the wrap, the best.
It didn’t fell or seemed or tasted quite like a dunkel...It was more like a stout,a dry stout...Yet,it was absolutely enjoyable,easy to drink.
Bottle. Dark brown, fine head. Burnt pinewood aroma, in a good way. The taste has cocoa, roasted malts, prunes and some nuttiness in it. Smooth like a stout.
draft. dark brown color, nice head. caramelish taste, too sweet for me. long palate.

Bottle from an "Auchan", Bp.
Nice appearanced dunkel with a dark brown/ruby colour and beige, creamy and laceing head on its top.
The smell is of toffee and grass.
A smooth mouthfeel escorts its sweet and toffee-liked flavour.
The aroma is of caramell malt and pleasant grassy/spicy hops with light yeasty undertones in the back.
The finish is toasty, spicy and light dry.
Very enjoyable.

On tap at U Medvidku, Prague on 11 July 2010. Crystal clear deep red-black with thick lowering creamy foam head giving some frothy lacing. Caramel malt in aroma; some citric notes and a beautiful blend of herb, grass and spice plays equally on the tastebuds. A bitter kick occurs when taking larger sips or gulps. This bitterness rests on the roof of the mouth and lingers in what I found to be a satisfying finish. Zingy mouthfeel. A very pleasant tmavý indeer, and incredibly easy drinking. UK drinkers may think of Goachers’ Mild on its best form at Maidstone.
Draught at KØ10. Mild malty aroma. Very dark brown colour. Very small tan head. The flavour is mild and spicy. A hoppy dunkel.

All-Bar-One, London
Pours a cola black body, tan head.
Whiff of roasted/burnt malts on the nose, some sweet colar-like notes.
Body is quite lean with high carbonation giving the beer a drying, somewhat astringent palate.
Coffee, smokey, bitter chocolate and cola sweetness on the body. Finishes bone dry, quite bitter.
Very nice.
Clour of dark caramel / brown, Aroma of caramel and malt. Tatse bitter and sweet. OK CO2,
On tap @ The Fly, Liverpool. Malty dark, some nut, reddish brown, roastiness. Looks great with its foamy tan head.

Bottle. Very dark brown beer with a nice off-white head. Weak aroma of roasted malt and bitter hops. Some sweetness of dried fruit and coffee malt in the flavour with a light bitter chocolate taste towards the end. Not wonderful by any means but quite enjoyable.

Bottle 33cl. A very dark beer with a nice head. Smell is on caramel and hop. Aroma is amasing on toasted and roasted malt, finish is bitter and long but dry. As the beer is less alcoholic and not sweet the brown aroma can be fully tasted and appreciated. Nice Munich malt and roasted barley flavor, a bit creamy. Very nice beer, well balanced, a pleasure.

Bottled. Pours clear deep amber with a large off-white head. Nose of malt, light hops and dried fruits. Sweet flavour with light roasted malt, caramel and with notes of dried fruit. Medium bodied. Slightly bitter finish. OK.

On tap at the Fighting Cocks, Moseley. Looks beautiful, with a nice contrast between the opaque body, and soft, white, meringue-like topping. Lovely in the mush, with a smooth, choc flavour, and pepper hint. Easy drinking.

Bottle bought in Trebon. Good head, slightly tan colored. Very dark brown colored beer, darker than a dunkel. Slight aroma of malt, roasted. Pretty good burnt taste. Slight hint of coffee and chocolate. Not very sweet, just a touch. Roasted malt finish, slightly dry, a bit of hop bitterness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. A good dark beer. Not out of the ordinary, but very nice and dry.

0.5l on tap. Dark brown color, medium light brown head. Medium carbonation. Taste is very malty, caramel, nuts and roasted coffee. Slightly sweet and a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste. Definitely better than the bottled version I think.

Nice black colour and brown creamy head. Intensive aroma of roasted malts and hay. Dry roasted flavour with quite good bitterness. Unfortunately almost no flavour on the roof of the mouth, and a bit watery texture but it is well hidden by the craggy hay feature which escorts the beer until the aftertaste. As time goes by, caramelic notes come around. A characteristic dunkel which is compulsory for everybody!
Tried at homebrew club this evening malts and quite liked it. Hints of liquorice and roasted malts in the aroma and taste on a dark brown body.

Very dark brown color, giving some head; aroma of roasted malt, some sweetness: hints of liquorice and caramel; medium body, mouthfeel thick enough, but still easy to drink; flavor of some caramel-like sweetness, mostly at first, but then balanced by roastness with some bitterness and dryness in the finish.
Bottle 50 cl. Black/deep rad with a nice lightbrown head. Aroma; sweet but then again aroma of roasted malt. Flavor; lots of roasted malt with some smoke in the aftertaste. quite nice
Very dark colour with a good head, roasted malt aroma, roast caramel taste, not bad.
500ml Bottle - Dark brown with a foamy head. Malty and slightly roasted aroma with hints of dried fruit. Malty and roasted taste with hints of nuts and chocolate.

From keg@Masné Krámy Beerhouse in České Budějovice. Dense, two-finger light brown head. Body is translucent, dark brown. Fresh, light acidulous aroma with coffee and cocoa. Notes of dark bread and hayish hops. Strong malt body, with roasted tones and a fine dryness. More coffee, cocoa and dark bread,  and also a hint of sour-sweet fruits and licorice. A gentle bitterness in the backbone. Crisp in the mouth. Very refreshing, high drinkability.
Bottle.Brown colour.Dry and smooth beer. Taste is sweet with caramel and roasty notes.
A nice, milky, smoked aroma.  Woody, sweet but with an ashy bitterness. Long dry wood finish.  Something coke-like about it. Pretty ace though not perfectly drinkable

Bottle, 500ml. A deep brown colour with a small head. Rich nutty aroma with roasted malt and chocolate. A very malty flavour with cocoa, caramel, nuttiness and a sweet, almost syrupy mouthfeel. A little citrus in the finish. Moderate carbonation. Definitely one I’ll buy again.
Bottle, Sainsbury’s. Brown colour, tan head. Aroma is toasted malts and caramel. Flavour is toasted malts, nuts, caramel. Not bad.
On tap in Prague, pours a dark brown. Smooth mouthful. Mild flavour of nuts, caramel and roasted malt. Much better than ordinary Budvar. Refreshing.
Probably the best dark Czech beer widely available. A dry and remarkably smooth beer that is well worth seeking out on draught when in the Czech Republic

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with a large tan head.  Roasted, malty aroma.  Flavor is mild, but full of roasted malt, caramel, nuts.  Fairly sweet, not much hoppiness.  Finish is full of caramel.  A mild but satisfying dunkel.
50cl bottle, local store. Pours dark color, malty aroma, taste is sweet and hint of caramel.
Bottled. A very elegant dark malty lezak with an invincible "duncan-macleodish" head. Delicious caramel and roasty notes too...

Bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with a off-white head that fades fairly slowly.. Sweet caramel nose, both strong and enticing. Good combination here of candy sweet caramel and roasted nuts, followed by smoe mild dry hops. The caramel lasts the longest, leaving a sweet aftertaste accented by a touch of bitter.
Rich hoppy aroma. Mahogany with medium off-white head. Strong malty flavour, slightly sweet. Hoppy palate. Finishes dark caramel. Quite good, but not the best.
Sampled in brewhouse in Prague. A really nice brew. Pours dark with a good thick head. A nice brew

On tap in Kolin.Pours almost black with a 2" creamy tan head, disappear fast. Hard to detect any aroma at all, could be malt...
Taste is light caramel, sweet and not very pleasant.
0,5lt Bottle. Dark brown with a medium off-white head. Roasted malt aroma with some caramel notes. Malty taste with some moderate bitterness.Rather light bodied.

Pours a dark chocolate brown. Aroma is very light, almost nothing really stands out. Mildly grassy/grainy. Flavor is similar to lager with just a dark appearance. Grassy/grainy flavor. Body is light with medium carbonation.

Dark red-black with medium beige head, roasted aroma, nuts, chocolate and some grain, flavor is smokey with some chocolate, coffee and some malts, finish is bitter and smoked. Body is medium. Nice dunkel.
50 cl bottle poured to glass. Dark brown body colour with quickly fading tan head. Sweet dunkel.

Beautiful and promissing dark brown color Unfortunately the taste doesn’t match the expectations. A good one but no big deal for a dark lager. I think it could be a lot better if it had a more bitter finish. Worth a try though, it’s a good beer. I just expected more!
Bottle. dark brown colour with a medium beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste with notes of fruits, chocolate and sugar. Light bitter finish.

Bottle. Dark brown with a red hue and a medium beige head with decent retention. Coffee, chocolate and some mild fruity notes on the nose. More coffee and chocolate tones in the flavour with roasted malts. A dry, short bitter finish, though crisp with light carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel and a lingering chocolate aftertaste.

Beautiful beer. Dark brown color with a fine creamy beige head. Aroma: hops, malt, caramel, chocolate. Taste: Dry, roasted malt, hops, bitter chocolate, coffee and a little smoky note also. Low sweetness.
on tap at Pivovarsky Klub, pours dark brown, medium light tan head, good lacing.  Light dark malt and candy apple aroma.  Creamy dark roasted malt flavor.  Light spicy finish.  Solid.

Nice transparent, clear brown color with red hue. Average sized, fluffy off white head. Intense roasted chocolate, caramel aroma. Roasted malt, toffee flavor with light bitter hoppy, slight smoky finish. Surprisingly light, easy body, lively carbonation, but smooth texture. Less complex and rich that i expected, but not bad.

50cl from superbest allerød.
pours dark brown, thick offwhite vanilla colored head.
aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, faint butter
flavor is roasted malts, coffee, rounded by dark chocolate. a real treat considering the low alc.
Copper with a lasting off-white head. Malty aroma with caramel and a roasted/burnt note. Sweet with some bready malt, roast malt, a little hop flavour and good bitterness.
A great Czech dunkel. Dark brown body with tan head. Malty nose. Taste of malts, caramel, some coffee. Smooth. Long finish. Some bitterness.
Bottle. Dark brown with a tanned head. Aroma of toasted malt and caramel. Malty flavour with some fruit coming through towards the end. Medium bodied.
caramel, brown, black, rocky head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, soft carbonation, slick feel, long finish, bitter, briliant dunkel
Decent enough lager, clean, crisp, dry and nicely bitter.  But paled in comparison to other lagers and pilsners in Prague, especially those on draught.

50cl bottle. It poured a dark brown colour with a big beige creamy head that settled down fast in the glass. The aroma is a bit acidious with notes of dark caramel, roasted malts and hints of vinegar. The flavour is bitter and tastes of roasted malts, dark caramel, and hints of citrus. It has a short aftertaste.Overall it is a bit disappointing compared to their regular lager.

On tap at Prague, a nice dark bar where Old St meets the Kingsland Rd, London. Thin body, plenty of tar and brackish tannin flavour, hint of citrus. Although its not all that  complex or flavousome, I enjoy this one more than a pilsner. A good winter beer.
Bottled. Dark amber body, tiny off-white head. Aroma of butter, malt, smoke. Taste a bit more smokey, quite smooth, good long finish.
On tap @ U Medvidku. Deep dark brown, beige head. Aroma of dark malts, caramel and some moccha. Flavour is the same, more roasted malts, slightly bitter finish. Neutral.

Bottled from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Dark brown coloured, big brown head. Nose of roasted malts and caramel. Bitter malty flavour, coffee. Not much going on besides some bitterness. Not bad, but i prefer their pilsener.
smells a bit funky, taste is slight tart, heavy malts, grassy hops and slightly metallic at the end.

On draught. An almost black colored beer, with a beige thick head. It disappears quickly. The aroma of dark malts, some coffee and chocolate. The taste is chocolate bitter, some coffee, dry and roasted malts. The aftertaste is pleasant dry bitter.

0.5L bottle, Small quickly diminishing head, dark brown almost opaque but with some lighter taints. Aroma mainly  of sour barnyard with a touch of caramel. Flavour made of bitter roasted coffee, almost no sweetness which make for an extremely dry beer. Feels a little light and watery, could have been  a little heavier.
On tap @ U Medvidku, Prague. Dark brown/black pour. Roasted malts aroma. Raoasted chocolaty malt taste, some coffee & toasted malts. Smooth & not bad at all

500ml bottle at home, courtesy of Finn.
Pours a tight, beige head over a deep, rosewood body. Satisfying aroma of roasted malt. Plenty of roastiness in flavour backed by the sweetness of cocoa and some gentle bitterness to a rather short ending. Flat carbonation and medium bodied (07.09.2008).

Bottle. Quite a good-looking beer of dark brown color with a big beige head that diminishes slowly. Aroma of some roasted malt, caramel and coffee notes. Sweet flavor with nice maltiness, caramel, some roastiness and some dark bread and coffee notes. A lingering drier finish, quite bitter, with light Saaz hoppiness. Medium-bodied, but could use a bit more body. A good Dunkel, I enjoyed this one almost as much as I enjoy the regular Budvar.

Re-rating. Bottle served daily at beach cafes in Kotor, Montenegro. Believe place and occasion might influence a rating, but finding this as more then less the only alternative to golden lagers I learned to appreciate a black lager. I actually had one alternative, but the Budweiser version was superior to the other one. Clear dark amber body with a nice, dense beige head. Aroma is mild toasted, dark malt, some liquorice, hint of coffee and some dark chocolate. Smooth flavor with the same ingredients that found in aroma, medium sweet and mild roasted.
